title: BEST OPTICAL ILLUSIONS TO KICK START YOUR BRAIN
tags: riddles,brain teasers,riddles with answers,brain teasers with answers,test your brain,puzzles,7-Second Riddles,best optical illusions,optical illusions,illusion games,tricky brain games,brain games,warm up your brain,well-trained brain,Hard riddles,tricky riddles,riddles for kids,riddles for adults,Amazing optical illusion,real or fake,optical illusion puzzles,cool riddles,stretch your brain,visual puzzle,find the hidden
description:
Here is a portion of the best optical illusions to kick-start your brain! Some of these tricky optical illusion games will break your mind! Try to focus on solving them and don't let anything bother you. These tricky brain games and puzzles will not just warm up your brain but also exercise it well.

00:14 - Can you read what's written in here? It's a cool way to test your brain!  If you can see these words and sentences clearly then probably you have a well-trained brain.
02:03 - Let's see how attentive you are! Find cute pandas in these pictures and try to do it as quick as possible.
03:51 - Can you tell for sure if it's the same photo?! Take your time and try to find differences between these pictures!
05:14 - Hard riddles that adults fail, but kids crack without any effort! Well, some kids do fail, but not many of them. To crack these tricky riddles for kids, you'll need to distance yourself from the picture and let your eyes just wander around and suddenly you'll start to see the hidden words everywhere 😮 
07:20 - Amazing optical illusion riddles and brain games to test your vision and brain as well! If your brain elastic (as it should be) then you will easily read all of them, however, if your brain is not stretched, then you should add up more into your brain exercises routine! 😎
09:32 - Can you guess right if these are real or fake? Sometimes it's almost impossible to find the right answer. These optical illusions will immediately blow your mind! 
11:16 - Put on your glasses and try to see who is hiding here! Only those with perfect vision will crack these optical illusion puzzles and will be to tell us who is hidden in the last illusion picture 🤓 

TELL me IN THE COMMENTS which optical illusion made you stuck in front of the screen for quite a time!

title: Dancing Star |  Dance Song for Kids  | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
tags: Brain Breaks,Dancing Star,brain breaks for kids,jack hartmann dancing star,dancing star jack hartmann,jack hartmann brain breaks,jack hartmann follow directions,jack hartmann songs,dancing,brain break,brain breaks following directions,jack hartmann brain break,jack hartmann brain break songs,following directions songs for children,jack hartmann dance,watch me watch me i can raise the roof,move and freeze,dancing stars,freeze dance,jack hartman
description:
Brain Breaks engage children with tons of physical education activities, dancing, creative movements, counting, patterning, shapes, freeze dance, self-esteem and more.

Dancing Star can be compared to the hugely popular Cha Cha Slide. Children follow directions and move together.

You can use brain breaks to start your day, anytime children need a positive physical activity, after lunch or for indoor recess on days with bad weather.

When I perform any of my brain breaks songs in concert, children love it. Dancing Star is no exception.

My brain breaks songs can be used in physical education classes too. Teachers love how the children have to stop and put their hands to their ears to listen carefully. This is a great song to teach children about following directions.
Dancing Star Words and Music by Jack Hartmann, copyright 2011 Jack Hartmann www.jackhartmann.com 

LYRICS:

Dancing Star
 
Watch me, watch me I can raise the roof 
Watch me, watch me I can shake it loose  Chorus 
Shake it down then jump it up so far
I can shine like a dancing star 
 
Let’s get loose and warm it up 
All together, step to the front
 Jump to the back and clap 
Raise your arms up in the air 
Back and forth like you just don’t care
 Right leg stomp to the left
 Left leg stomp to the right 
One arm up shake your hips 
I can disco just like this Now stop and pose 
Be cool, slide to the right 
Be cool, slide to the left Jump up and count 
 
Robo dance, move it, block it like a robot You got it 
 
(Chorus) 
 
 
Now everybody square it up 
Step to the back, slide to the right 
Step to the front, slide to the left 
Now cabbage patch, arms circle around, be cool get down
 Country dance, stomp and clap 
Now turn around, clap like this 
Turn around again, clap like this 
Right leg stomp to the left, left leg stomp to the right 
Now jump up, criss-cross, criss-cross 
Shake your shoulders, shake your hips 
Shake it like a salt shaker, like this
 Now turn around, clap like this 
Turn around again, clap like this 
your own dance, dance free
 Now freeze Let’s cool it down, do the sprinkler 
Take it down, that was fun, we’re done 

Dancing Star is on my album, Brain Breaks:
https://www.jackhartmann.com/album/brain-breaks-brain-breaks-by-jack-hartmann/

title: Brain Breaks | Calendar Song | Springtime Dance | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartmann,brain breaks,children's songs,educational songs,children's music,kids music,kids videos,kids songs,Brain Breaks,Calendar Song,Springtime Dance,spring songs for kids,spring song,jack hartmann spring,spring dance,spring dance for kids,spring song for kids,spring time dance,springtime dance jack hartmann,spring songs,jack hartman spring,springtime song,spring brain break,spring time song,spring songs for preschoolers
description:
Celebrate spring with this super fun spring song that will motivate all young children to move and dance! Springtime Dance can be used as a great brain breaks activity too to help get lots of wiggles out and get everyone thinking about spring. Teachers and parents can use this upbeat dance song to introduce so many topics about spring ( ie. flowers ready to bloom, grass and the leaves on trees growing again and turning green, the weather getting warmer, getting closer to the last months of school, bugs and insects, and lots more )

Springtime Dance can also highlight your spring calendar lessons and learning about the seasons and how they are a cycle and go round and round. Spring is also a time we can more of our animal friends.

Let your children dance and sing to celebrate spring with Springtime Dance!

LYRICS:

Springtime Dance

It’s Spring!
Flowers grow, reach for the sun
Beautiful colors for everyone      Chorus
The season of winter now has passed
Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

Bunny Hop, it’s Springtime
Bird dance, it’s Springtime
Sprinkler, it’s Springtime
Flower dance, it’s Springtime

Flowers grow, reach for the sun
Beautiful colors for everyone      Chorus
The season of winter now has passed
Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

description:
Online Kids Classes  #41 ♫ Music and movement for preschoolers by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station): Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Get Funky (Fun, Silly Live Action Song) (Also, known as the Funky Monkey)
❤12 Months of the Years (Learn the Months Movement Song)
❤Willy Dilly Diddle Hop (Fun, Silly Action Song)
❤Find the Shapes Out-Takes (Fine Shapes and Out-takes)
**************************************************************************
Get Funky(Also, known as the Funky Monkey) is a great brain breaks action, dance song to make it easy and fun to take a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance and move then they can return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. Schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. This brain breaks dance song is perfect for preschool, kindergarten, elementary and physical education.

Get Funky (Also, known as the Funky Monkey)
From the CD, Get Funky and Musical Fun
By The Learning Station 
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
LYRICS:
(Activity: This can be done as a line dance. Follow the directions.)
Are you ready to dance and boogie? Let's go. Get in line.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Step to the right and shake. Step to the left and snake. Step backwards. Step forwards.
Now jump. Jump again.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Now slide to the right real smooth. Slide to the left in the groove.
Right foot stomp. Stomp two times. Left foot stomp. Stomp two times.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Jump, jump two times. Jump, jump two times.
Now reach and sway and shake it your way.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Can you hear me? Can you hear me now? (4X)
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Take two steps to the right and shimmy. Two steps to the left, now gimmie a backstroke.
Jump, jump two times.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Jump two times. Right foot stomp. Jump three times. Left foot stomp.
Jump, jump two times. Jump, now, freeze.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Reach, now touch the floor. Twist, do you want some more?
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Can you hear me? Can you hear me now?

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC, LLC
Hip educational songs & videos for the K-2 Classroom!

Song: IF YOU'RE A KID... (EARTH DAY REMIX!)
Educational Content: This is the EARTH DAY REMIX version of my popular "If You're a Kid" song. Students can follow along in the verses as they are asked to follow "Earth Day-themed" directions, based on if they are a boy or a girl (ex: throw away litter, unplug your plugs, turn off the water, recycle, etc.) In the chorus, ALL students are encouraged to dance around "if they are GREEN!"

Download/purchase this song directly at Teachers Pay Teachers by following this link:

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC FREEBIES:
This song is a FREEBIE. You can stream it for free on YouTube, but also buy it at my website. I am already offering 60+ of my hip educational songs/videos on YouTube FOR FREE at youtube.com/harrykindergarten. Enjoy them, utilize them, and share them! I am a current full-time Kindergarten teacher so I know what it's like to be looking around for quality content in my classroom! You can ALSO purchase the raw video file and/or audio file of those 60+ songs at my website (if you need them for some reason) or at Teachers Pay Teachers. I will continue to make freebie videos (ones you can just stream on YouTube for free) periodically, so continue to check back to see if I've posted any. 

*Please DO NOT rip any of my videos off of YouTube and upload them to your YouTube channel. I want the Harry Kindergarten Music channel to be the hotspot for these videos, not random teachers' channels who happened to illegally take them off of mine. If you really want to have a playlist of them, create a playlist from MY channel or purchase them on my website so you have the raw files. THANKS FOR UNDERSTANDING!

Q: Do you speak at conferences?
A: Yes! My ability to speak at teacher conferences during the school year is "tight" because I am currently a classroom teacher and only have a set number of personal days. However, the SUMMER time is wide-open and I'd love to come to your conference and do a session/seminar! Some of the topics I've typically spoken to teachers about include music and technology in the classroom, classroom management, running a creative morning meeting, and utilizing YouTube in the early childhood classroom. Email me at pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com to make a speaking request.

Q: Can my class perform a "Harry Kindergarten song" for an audience?
A: If you desire to have your class or group of students perform one of my “Harry Kindergarten” songs for an audience, please note that there is a $6.00 PERFORMANCE FEE.

Here are some hypothetical examples of performance groups:
* Students perform a song for an audience during a graduation ceremony.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school or community talent show.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school assembly.
If you are unsure if you need to purchase a performance license or not, please inquire at: pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com. If you want more details about using a song multiple years or multiple classes, etc., e-mail me for a detailed PDF file. 

$6.00 can be sent to:

Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC

508 Stewart Street

Bellwood, PA 16617

title: Welcome to Brain Breaks!!!
description: Brain breaks are a series of short videos designed to get our kids moving in short bursts of fun exercise during their school work. They have been designed to get the whole body moving in short but fun videos. It is important for our kids to move as they are spending large amounts of time sitting down and this series has been designed to get them moving in between different bits of set work.

Jeanette is a child/family/adult therapist with a special focus on adopted and foster care issues which derived from her own experience of being adopted and moving through the foster care system in New York City. Her personal experience has informed her education and provided insight into the unique stresses involved with these issues. Because of Jeanette’s life experience she can more easily connect and relate to the children and teens she works with. She is an exceptional child-care worker who is dedicated to helping each of her clients reach their full potential through mental health therapy and make the difficult journey from despair towards resiliency and hope.

title: Brain Breaks | Around The World | Brain Breaks Song | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartman around the world,around the world– jack hartmann,count to 100,around the world jack hartmann,jack hartmann hello around the world,educational songs,Jack Hartmann,brain breaks,brain breaks song,brain breaks jack hartmann,jack hartmann brain breaks,spatial concepts,around the world song,jack hartmann around the world,hello all around the world jack hartmann,spatial concepts song,stretching song for kids,let's go around the world
description:
Around the World is a great Brain Breaks and exercise song. This brain breaks song also teaches children some basic spatial concepts (front, back, side to side and right and left and number awareness).

Classroom teachers and physical education teachers can do with children quickly and easily everyday. 

It engages children with extended arm circle moves and full body stretching and counting out loud. It also includes some basic subtraction as each time we stretch all around one number is taken away.  The repetition of this in the song makes it so simple and easy to follow.

Children can really get some exercise participating in all the moves in this song. It's a good workout song and the children will have fun moving together. It also builds endurance as this song really gets you moving for several minutes continually.

I just love the beat with some cool pop country music makes you want to do it too.

title: Silly Pirate Song | Brain Breaks | Growing Pattern Song | Educational Songs | Jack Hartmann
tags: silly pirate song,silly pirate,pirate song,sequencing songs,growing patterns,growing patterns for kids,sequencing song for kids,sequencing song for kindergarten,jack hartmann pirate song,the pirate song,pirate song jack hartmann,pirate songs for children,jack hartmann silly pirate song,jack hartmann pirate,pirate songs for kids,the silly pirate song,pirate song for kids,jack hartman pirate,interrupting pirate,kids pirate songs,jack hartmann
description:
Silly Pirate Song is an educational song for kids that covers sequencing, following a growing pattern, comprehension and story recall. All these skills are very important developmental skills for young children. 

This pirate song for kids continues to be one of my most popular original songs. Children really use their imaginations as they act out each character's part. This movement on this children's pirate song is super fun.

Teachers and Parents can extend the learning after the video by asking these questions. 

Who is your favorite character?

Can you tell me what order the characters appear in?

How many characters did you see?

The simple rhythm and great melody of Silly Pirate Song continues to make this pirate song for kids a favorite of children around the world.

LYRICS:

Silly Pirate Song

Once there was a pirate who sang a pirate song
Then interrupting the pirate, a surfer came along

You’d hear…Yo, ho, ho, hee,hee, hee
Hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Hey dude surfs up
A pirate’s life for me

Repeat Chorus Line

A big shark came along
You’d hear…Yo, ho, ho ho, hee, hee, hee
Chomp, chomp, hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A helicopter came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Swoosh, swoosh, chomp, chomp, hey,
dude surfs up
A pirates life for me
Repeat

Repeat chorus Line

An octopus came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Wiggle wiggle, swoosh, swoosh, chomp, chomp,
Hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A submarine came along
You’d hear…
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Up periscope, wiggle, wiggle, swoosh,
Swoosh, chomp, chomp, hey dude, surf up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line
A singing mermaid came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
La, La, la, up periscope
Wiggle, wiggle, swoosh, swoosh chomp, chomp
hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A police boat came along
You’d hear…Yo,ho,ho,hee,hee,hee
Stop-freeze, la,la,la, up periscope
Wiggle, wiggle, swoosh, swoosh,
Chomp, chomp, he dude surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, ho, hee hee, hee

Repeat Movements

A pirates life for me
A pirates life is…not for me!
There are too many interruptions!

tags: jack hartmann rags,jack hartmann,rags jack hartmann,my dog rags,i have a dog and his name is rags,brain breaks,my dog rags song,children's songs,flip flop wig wag zig zag,rags the dog,educational songs,children's music,rags song for kids,kids music,kids videos,kids songs,rags by jack hartmann,rags,rags jack hartman,rags kids song,rags dog song,rags the dog song,i have a dog his name is rags,rags songs,rags nursery rhymes
description:
Kids absolutely love this popular kids movement and rhyming song about a dog named Rags.  It’s a great brain breaks activity to get kids singing, moving and hearing the fun rhyming and language play of flip – flop, wig – wag & zig – zag.  

All young kids love singing this catch phrase and follow in the fun movements I do on the video.  Rags is just fantastic for developing rhyming awareness, listening skills and gross motor movement.

Rags is like a super fun nursery rhyme with lots of movement.  I sing this song “live” at many of my concerts and it’s always a great favorite to get everybody moving, smiling and singing.  

Rags is simply a wonderful brain breaks song, a rhyming awareness and language play song and just a fun movement song everyone enjoys.

Lyrics
I've got a dog and his name is Rags
He eats so much that his tummy sags
His ears flip-flog and his tail wig wags
And when he walks he walks zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
I love Rags and he loves me

My dog Rags he loves to play
He rolls around in the mud all day
I call him, he doesn't obey
He always runs the other way
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag

I love Rags and he loves me

title: Dr. Jean's Banana Dance - (aka The Guacamole Song) - Dr. Jean's Banana Dance
tags: Banana,Dance,Dr.,Jean,Feldman,physical,activity,obesity,move,fun,sing,kids,teachers,school,avocado,guacamole,Music nurtures phonemic awareness,top ten reasons to SING every day
description:
Dr. Jean has released this song and video on youtube for teachers and parents to enjoy with their children. 

Watch top left corner for a link to the lyrics around 42 seconds. Or, use this link: http://drjean.org/html/youTube.html. If you check the lyrics, you will soon learn whether it is form or farm. 

All of Dr. Jean's music is available on iTunes. This song is on the CD set Better Bodies and Brains.The song is available on iTunes and Amazon.

You learn on your feet, not on your seat! When children move, dance, and wiggle, more senses are activated and the message is more likely to get to the brain. Music and movement also emit endorphins which make you happy. These activities are great for cardio, eye-hand coordination, flexibility, strength, and children's BRAINS! Children will also develop body spatial awareness, cooperation, self-control, social skills, and they will learn to listen and follow directions. It feels good to feel good, and when children feel good their behavior improves! See more at drjean.org

Here are the top ten reasons to SING every day!

1. When you sing your brain emits endorphins, and endorphins make you happy!  Emotions are critical to learning.

2. Music is multi-sensory.  The more senses you get going to the brain, the more likely the message will get there.

3. Music is powerful for prior-learning.  If children are exposed to concepts while singing, it is easier for them to learn when formally introduced.

4. Music nurtures phonemic awareness (alliteration, rhyme, etc.).

5. Songs and chants are a natural way to develop oral language and auditory memory.

6. Poems and songs lay a foundation for fluency and enhance short term memory.

7. Children are able to use their imaginations and create pictures in their brains when they sing.  This is an important part of reading comprehension.

 8. Repetition is a key to learning.  It is much more fun to repeat songs than worksheets!

 9. Singing and dancing relieve stress and oxygenate the brain.

10. Through music and movement ALL children can feel successful.  A “community of learners” is enhanced when teachers and children enjoy something together!

There was a study that was reported on National Public Radio called “Alive Inside.”  In the research study they made iPods of songs that had a special significance to patients suffering from dementia and Alzheimer’s.  These patients didn’t recognize family members, but when they heard the music they tapped their feet, sang the words, and smiled!  So many things that we do in our classrooms will be forgotten, but the songs will be stored in children’s brains for a lifetime!  What a privilege to be able to do this!

title: Fractions Song For Kids | 2nd Grade - 3rd Grade
tags: Fractions,Fractions For Kids,Fractions Song,Fractions Song for Kids,Fractions Kindergarten,Fractions 1st Grade,Fractions 2nd Grade,Fractions 3rd Grade,Fractions Grade 1,Fractions Grade 2,Fractions Grade 3,Fractions are Parts,What are Fractions,What are Fractions For Kids,teaching fractions to children,teaching fractions 2nd grade,teaching fractions 3rd grade,fractions for kindergarten,Fractions For Kids Song
description:
🍎  Enjoy our growing library of math videos beyond our fractions song for kids at https://www.numberock.com  🍎

»»-------------¤-------------««»»-------------¤-------------««

Q. What is a fraction?
A. A fraction has a numerator (the top number) and a denominator (the bottom number).  The numerator is how many parts (cookies, slices, things etc.) we have, while the denominator represents how many times those parts are being divided/shared.

Q. What grade levels does our Fractions Song For Kids target?
A. 2nd Grade - 3rd Grade.

Q. Where did you guys come from?
A. Numberock is a project that I, Mr. Hehn, began as a 5th Grade math teacher of 7 years.  It came together after years of experimenting with my lessons trying to figure out the best way to help my students retain the math concepts they were learning.  

Q. Does Numberock drive real results in the classroom?
A. I knew I found the secret sauce when not only were my students retaining the concepts longer, they were singing the songs outside of the classroom during recess and at home with their parents during dinnertime.  The songs were so catchy, my students couldn't get the math songs out of their head!  

During testing, I often found my students humming the melodies in order to jostle their memory of a rule or problem solving process.  As we've all experienced, there is something about the power of music that allows us to retain information easier and for longer periods of time.  Without getting into the finer details of multi-sensory learning and how it often helps the students who most need the help, the power of a catchy song is hard to deny.

Q. I love your songs.  Where can I experience more of what NUMBEROCK has to offer?

We have additional teaching resources that are always expanding over at https://www.numberock.com.  For the low price of $4.95/month, premium members gain access to video-aligned activities like worksheets, printable posters/anchor charts, task cards, self-graded assessments, games, and more.  

Coming Soon:
1. Self-Graded Assessments | These will soon be available for every Common Core and TEKS standard from 2nd-6th Grade so you'll be able to track and monitor student progress while your students complete standards-aligned quizzes that are integrated with the NUMBEROCK video they just watched.

2. Number Notes | Were currently working on creating exercises where students will be able to take notes artistically on printable templates featuring characters from the videos.  

Research has shown that this will help to integrate their artistic side side of the student's brain with the mathematical side of their brain which helps with long-term memory retention.  Our own research has shown us that teacher's who use start using these templates love them!  It seems to be a natural fit as we move beyond our unique auditory learning tools into visual learning tools, that when used in concert, cater to the different types of learners that you teach everyday.

Hope to see you at https://numberock.com!

This fractions video is aligned with the following Common Core and TEKS standards:

Common Core Standards
3.NF.A.1 | 3.NF.1
Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.
3.NF.A.2 | 3.NF.2
Understand a fraction as a number on the number line; represent fractions on a number line diagram.

TEKS Standards
2.3B 
The student is expected to explain that the more fractional parts used to make a whole, the smaller the part; and the fewer the fractional parts, the larger the part.
3.3A
The student is expected to represent fractions greater than zero and less than or equal to one with denominators of 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 using concrete objects and pictorial models, including strip diagrams and number lines.

title: Geometry: Lines & Angles Songs For Kids | 3rd Grade - 5th Grade
tags: Numberock,NUMBERROCK,NUMBER ROCK,Shapes Song,Shape Song,Shapes,Shape,Shapes Song For Kids,Shapes for Kindergarten,geometric shapes,geometric shapes song,Shapes song for children,Geometry Songs,Math Songs,Shape Songs,Shape Songs for Kids,Triangles Song,Quadrilaterals Song,Lines SOng,Volume Song,3d Shapes Song
description:
🍎 Enjoy our growing library of math videos at https://www.numberock.com  🍎

Lesson Plan and Materials Below:
🍎  Check our our Geometry Unit Lesson Plans ▶ https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Geometry-Unit-2459996  🍎
🍎  Get all our ad-free videos,, games, posters, lesson materials & more! ▶ https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/NUMBEROCK-Geometric-Shapes-Song-For-Children-The-Complete-Library-2200780  🍎



»»-------------¤-------------««»»-------------¤-------------««

Numberock Songs for:
3rd Grade - 5th Grade Elementary School Math
UK Equivalent 
Year 4 - Year 6 KS2 Maths

»»-------------¤-------------««»»-------------¤-------------««

What/Who is NUMBEROCK?

We make animated math videos and educational songs for kids that bring joy back into math class and make it cool again!  Up until today, we have created nearly 30 animated music videos that cover mathematical concepts for 3rd Grade, 4th Grade, and 5th Grade; concepts like, Rounding Numbers, Ordering Decimals, Subtraction, 3D Shapes, Types of Angles and much more!  

We're curious to see how our teaching resource will be used now that we have shared them with a broader audience.  Thanks for your interest.

How did NUMBEROCK begin?

When you look at the entertainment that’s being
produced for kids in games and movies, it’s no wonder
that kids are starting to zone out in school. 

During the last 7 years as an elementary public school teacher, I’ve
always tried to find new ways to capture my students’
full attention, especially for that one subject that gets
such a notoriously bad rap in elementary school – math.

One day I brought my guitar in to school to play a song
I’d written about Long Division that was accompanied
by some simple animations I’d made. While not all my
students liked the folk rock genre, I could tell I had everyone’s attention.

Soon I began writing songs in genres that my students
actually listened to: rap, rock, pop, country, you name
it. Parents would tell me that their kids were singing the
songs in the car, at dinner, even teaching them to their
siblings. Almost in disbelief that kids were singing my
math songs for fun outside of school, I felt encouraged
and inspired to keep writing. Then, three years ago, I
had one of those ‘AHA!’ moments: to write a song with a
simple animation for every math concept I had to teach.

Altogether, from 2008 to now, I’ve written songs for
nearly 50 concepts, 30 of which are now professionally
animated. Lesson materials to help maximize learning
for those 30 songs are available at "Teachers Pay Teachers", 
a website where teachers, homeschoolers, and parents can buy high quality learning materials. 

I hope your student(s) will find a renewed passion for math as
they access the NUMBEROCK method.

title: This Is Number Zero | Math Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
tags: number zero,number zero song,number zero song for kids,number zero video,number zero song for kindergarten,zero song,zero song for kids,zero song for kindergarten,zero,0 song,0 song for kids,number 0,number 0 song,number 0 song for kids,number 0 song for kindergarten,zero the hero,zero the hero song,zero the hero video,0 the hero,placeholder,zero is a placeholder,subtraction word problems,subtraction song,word problems,subtraction,Jack Hartmann
description:
This is Number Zero song.  Zero is our hero in this zero song for kids. Zero is a very important number. Find out how to make the number zero.  Zero is a placeholder. Learn about adding zero to a number and subtracting zero from a number. In our word problems equations we illustrate that zero equals none. 


Lyrics
Everybody up, nobody sit
This is number zero and it looks like this
Everybody move, nobody quit

Move your body make a zero just like this
Start at the top, curve around
No straight lines go all the way around
Start at the top, curve around
No straight lines go all the way around
Zero, zero, this is number zero

Zero is a placeholder so you know
If the number is tens, hundreds or more
Zero, zero, zero is our hero
Zero is a number that helps us out
So learn about zero to help you count
Let's move, check it out

Three jet planes are flying in the sky
Fly, fly, flying in the sky
They all flew down and landed on the ground
How many jet planes are flying now?
Zero, zero not  1
That's what zero means, none 

Five horses are galloping on the track
Gallop, gallop, galloping on the track
They finish the race and all lay down
How many horses are galloping now?
Zero, zero not  1
That's what zero means, none 

Zero, zero, this is number zero
Zero, zero, zero is our hero

Two penguins are waddling on the ice
Waddle, waddle, waddling on the ice
They dove in the water with a funny sound 
How many penguins are waddling now?
Zero, zero not  1
That's what zero means, none 

One truck is rolling down the road
Roll, roll, rolling down the road
It stopped at the store and the engine cooled down
How many trucks are rolling now?
Zero, zero not  1
That's what zero means, none 

Zero is a placeholder so you know
If the number is tens, hundreds or more
Zero, zero, zero is our hero
Zero is a number that helps us out
So learn about zero to help you count
Zero is cool 
Zero is a number don't forget
Add zero to a number that's the number you get
Zero, oh yeah
Zero is a number don't forget
Subtract zero from a number that's the number you get

10 little turkeys sat in their pen.
   "Hide, turkeys, hide." said the little red hen.
   One little turkey flew far away,

   9 little turkeys sat in their pen.
   "Hide, turkeys, hide." said the little red hen.
   One little turkey flew out of the gate,
   and when he was gone, there were eight.
   
   8 little turkeys sat in their pen.
   "Hide, turkeys, hide." said the little red hen.
   One little turkey flew far away,
   but the other seven decided to stay.
   
   7 little turkeys sat in their pen.
   "Hide, turkeys, hide." said the little red hen.
   One little turkey hid with the chicks,
   and when she was gone, there were six.
   
   6 little turkeys sat in their pen.
   "Hide, turkeys, hide." said the little red hen.
   One little turkey flew far away,
   but the other five decided to stay.

title: Learning English? How to Break Through the English Learning Plateau!
tags: learn english,learning english,learn english with subtitles,bob the canadian,yt:cc=on,english lesson,english video with subtitles,english subtitles,english plateau,language plateau,stuck learning english,how to make progress when learning english,english learning progress,intermediate plateau language learning,language learning tips and tricks,language learning motivation,how to overcome the intermediate plateau
description:
Sometimes when you are learning English you feel like you aren't making progress. You have hit a plateau. A plateau in learning occurs when you keep working at learning, but you can't seem to get better at the language.

This occurs because your mind adapts to the things you are doing. The routines you have developed to learn English have become routine and you are used to them. You need to change things up a bit.

In this English lesson I will help you understand what a learning plateau is, and I'll give you 5 important strategies that you can use to break through the English learning plateau!

⌛ Remember:  Always watch the video three times.  Twice today with English subtitles on, and once tomorrow with the English subtitles off.  This will reinforce the English you have learned!

--

title: Look Out for Bossy R | Fun Phonics Song for Kids | English Song for Children | Jack Hartmann
tags: Bossy r,bossy r song,controlled r,controlled r song,phonics song,phonics song for kids,phonics song for kindergarten,phonics for kindergarten,r controlled vowel,controlling r,controlling r sound,controlling r song,controlling r words,controlled r words,controlled r for kids,controlled r vowels,controlled r video,bossy r video,bossy r video for kids,bossy r words,bossy r song for kids,Jack Hartmann,bossy r video first grade
description:
This bossy r song show vowels that have an r after them change their sound.  The r bosses them around and they become r controlled vowels.  Sing along with Jack Hartmann and listen to how bossy r can change vowel sounds.  Bossy r song for kindergarten.   

Lyrics
Look out for bossy r
Bossy r
When you read you'll be a star
Look out for bossy r
Bossy r
When you read you'll be a star

Look out for when bossy r comes after a vowel
It changes the sound of the vowel somehow
Look and listen to what happens 
When bossy r comes after a vowel

Take the word cat
A says/a/
Add bossy r after the vowel
Now you have cart
Ar says /ar/
Bossy R

Take the word bun
U says/u/
Add bossy r after the vowel
Now you have burn
Ur says /ur/
Bossy R

Take the word bid
I says /i/
Add bossy r after the vowel
Now you have bird
Ir says /ir/
Bossy R

Take the word hut
U says  /u/
Add bossy r after the vowel
Now you have hurt
Ur says /ur/
Bossy R

Take the word chip
I says /i/
Add bossy r after the vowel
Now you have chirp
Ir says /ir/
Bossy R

Look out for bossy r
Bossy r
When you read you'll be a star
Look out for bossy r
Bossy r
When you read you'll be a star
Bossy R

description:

Song Lyrics

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

Verse 1

Follow me along
See if you can do
All the sounds and movements 
That you might see in a zoo
You might be surprised
At how easy it can be
To imitate the animals
In this menagerie


Chorus

Soar as high as an eagle
Squawk like an Aussie cockatoo
Hang out like a sloth
Or waddle like a duck
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too


Verse 2

It’s not very hard
To copy what you see
To hop and stomp and crawl or swim 
Like creatures in the sea
Or talk to the animals
With a ‘woof’ or ‘quack’ or ‘moo’
Or growl and roar at dinner time
Like lions in the zoo

Chorus

Swing and scratch like a monkey
Snort and prance like gnu
Gallop like a zebra
Or slink like a fox
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too!

description:
This video helps kids learn how to release physical and emotional tension. We play a game where they make their bodies really tight, squeezing all of their muscles and then relax all of their muscles as much as possible. Games like this help to regulate kids' emotions through mindfulness exercises.  Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset? Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day.

title: Spelling for Kids - Mr. B's Brain - Ep. 5: Stretching, Breaking, and Sounding Out Words
tags: spelling,breaking words,stretching words,sounding out words,phonics,cvc words,spelling video,kindergarten spelling,learning to spell,teach spelling,spelling for kids,Remote education,distance education,at home education,Remote learning,distance learning,at home learning,what is distance education,home school,special education,Home school,homeschool,online learning,how to sound out words,autism,teaching special education,teach how to spell
description:
Spelling for Kids shows how to stretch and break words, and pick the proper vowel sound.

Other Mr. B's Brain Videos:
Subtraction Magic: https://youtu.be/96kDx-yw3f0
Phonics Reading: https://youtu.be/tpLKilWB3mw
Addition Gameshow: https://youtu.be/BIu3QBSn0ig
2D vs. 3D Shapes: https://youtu.be/YxoLlSTu1jo
Addition Song: https://youtu.be/v6cMscvg3TE

Please like, share, and subscribe!  
Follow us on Instagram: @mr._bs_brain
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MrBs-Brain-978358632371933/
https://www.mrbsbrain.com/

Mr. B's Brain shows that sounding out words is systematic: stretch the word slowly, break it into its component chunks, listen closely for the vowel sound, and finally write what you hear.

For most children, some time around preschool, kindergarten, or first grade they start to see words not as whole units, but small chunks that come together to form words.   Sure worksheet practice is part of the process, but our video will bring another part to that: fun visuals and examples to help children see the pattern to spelling.  That way they will be ready for the spelling test!  We use fun, fancy clipart to bring together our electronic program.  It's for the beginner, early primary grade spellers, typically a 6 year old or under.  And remember, early spelling is not always about being correct, but listening for the acceptable sounds they hear (e.g. "bat" might be "bt" "bet" or even just "b").  The words you select should be a challenge level of medium without frustration, and practice throughout the week as you would any skill you want to improve.  If the child is having trouble hearing sounds in words, switch to a visual style as that might be a stronger way of processing for that particular kid.

Our goal at Mr. B's Brain is to use YouTube as an enrichment for school.  We aim to help each student with animated learning opportunities.  We have gotten feedback that our lessons are effective for the toddler all the way to the adult - as it helps moms and dads learn how to teach their students in better ways.  We've done a patient search of video Youtube content, surveyed teachers, looked at what was effective in the classroom, analyzed lesson plans, and then came to create what you see before you.  We are proud of our free high resolution short videos that are a great tool to join with a traditional education.  You have our permission to use them in your home, preschool, kindergarten class, first grade classroom, or anywhere else you'd like to.  Thanks for your support, enjoy!

title: Partner Brain Break: "Keep Your Head Up"
tags: brain break,brain breaks for kindergarten,brain breaks in the classroom,conscious discipline,conscious discipline songs,conscious discipline i love you rituals,brain smart start songs,brain smart start conscious discipline,partner brain breaks,keep your head up andy grammer,pop brain breaks,songs to connect kids,school family song
description:
Here's the moves we came up with to the "Keep Your Head Up" song by Andy Grammer. So grab a partner and let's get ready to breathe, connect, and rock this brain break!  ♥OPEN FOR MORE♥
____________________________

BACKSTORY: Tired of the traditional Brain Break songs available, my daughter Avery and I set out to create some fun new brain breaks to popular songs that not only get your body moving, but also serve as opportunities for connection and eye contact with peers and adults to help support healthy relationships. These work great as part of a Conscious Discipline "Brain Smart Start" in how they incorporate opportunities to 1- Unite (everyone doing the same actions) 2- Disengage Stress (deep breathing), 3- Connect (hugs and eye contact).  So enjoy the break and have fun connecting with those you love both at school and at home!
____________________________

Intersted in learning more about Conscious Discipline for your home or classroom, click here to learn more: https://consciousdiscipline.com

My Other Conscious Discipline video: "How to Connect with Kids Using I Love You Rituals": https://youtu.be/bl7b3TespAw

title: "Together Again" Fun Brain Break Song for Kids
description: Hello Everybody. Here is a great song to sing in the morning while students have a lot of energy. This song "Together Again" also shares the expectation of your class that students and teachers will sing and be happy because we're all here together again! I like to sing this song with an accelerando to help students get all of their silly energy out. After clapping, stomping, and patting, you can come up with any type of movement you would like to do. You can even allow students to come up with their own movement or pose. Use this time to help students stretch and gain focus while also acting silly. It is all about finding a balance!

title: Tooty Ta | Hip Hop Tooty Ta | Tooty Ta Hip Hop | Tooty Ta Song | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
tags: tooty ta,tootie tot song,tooty ta jack hartmann,a tooty ta song,jack hartmann tooty ta,tootie tot,a tooty ta,tooty ta hip hop,a tootie tot,tootie ta,atutita atutita,tutti tot song,atutita atutita atutita,tooty ta hip hop jack hartmann,tooty ta song,hip hop tooty ta,tooty,tooty ta dr jean,thumbs up elbows back song,atutita,tootie tot hip hop,tutti ta ta,jack hartmann,tooty ta jack
description:
Tooty Ta is super popular children’s song as part of your “brain breaks” for students to get some fun physical activity, and rejuvenate their body and brain. Children everywhere love Tooty ta!

Hip-Hop Tooty Ta can really help to re-focus student’s attention, get a mental and physical break from their academics  enabling them to have a better focus for learning.  Using my cool 
Hip-Hop Tooty-Ta as a “brain break” is a win-win situation. Students learn during these “brain breaks” plus return to a task renewed and energized.

Classroom and Physical Education teachers as well as home learners can quickly and easily use Tooty Ta to give students fun and energizing brain breaks.

It is important that our children get opportunities throughout the day for movement. My Hip-Hop Tooty Ta has a cool contemporary beat that kids today really love.  Of all the Tooty Ta songs out there, children and teachers all over the country and the world love my version.

Check out some of our Hip-Hop dance moves which are ideal for crossing the mid-line.  It’s also important for your children to hear the alliteration of Tooty Ta to develop their phonological awareness for listening to the sounds in our language.

tags: we're going on a bear hunt,bear,hunt,parents,michael rosen,rosen,children's,going on a bear hunt,bear hunt song,songs for kids,for kids,kids,kids song,kids songs,the kiboomers,we are going on a bear hunt,we are going on a bear hunt song,kids video,songs for children,songs,song,preschool,rhymes,kindergarten,lyrics,nursery,rhyme,youtube,chant,video,preschoolers,toddlers,songs and actions,phonics,popular,prepositions,action songs,storytime
description:
The Kiboomers!  Grab your binoculars, we're going on a bear hunt!  We're Going on a Bear Hunt is a fun action song for kids. It helps introduce prepositions to young children.
★Get this song on iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/rea...
Watch our ‘We're Going On A Bear Hunt’ video and sing along with the kids!

'WE'RE GOING ON A BEAR HUNT SONG LYRICS':

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Oh, Look at that tall wavy grass
It's so tall

Can't go over it X2
Can't go under it X2
Just going to have to go through it X2
swish swish swish 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Uh oh, there's a big river
Can't go over it X2 
Can't go under it X2 
Going to have to swim it X2
splash splash splash 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Ugh, look at all that mud
so muddy
Can't go over it X2
Can't go under it X2
Going to have to go through it
squish squish squish 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Uh oh, what's that
It's a cave
We can't go over it
We can't go under it
Going to have to go into it
step step step 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared 
I'm a little scared

Sure is dark in here
What's that in the corner
I feel 2 big ears X 2
I feel 1 wet nose X 2
I feel 2 sharp teeth X2 
I know what that is
It's a bear

Let's get out of here

Let's run out of the cave
step step step 

Quickly back through the mud
squish squish squish

Let's cross the river
splash splash splash 

Through the tall grass
swish swish swish


Through the yard, up the stairs, into the house, close the door

We're safe

That's a close one

Let's not go bear hunting anymore!

If you like this video, please subscribe to the Kiboomu channel : http://youtube.com/kiboomu

tags: the learning station,feelings song,emotions song,feelings and emotions,feelings song for children,emotions song for kids,the feelings song,emotions for kids,emotions kids,feelings songs,emotions song for preschool,learning station songs,Angry Song,Angry,emotions song for kindergarten,feelings,expressing our feelings,emotion song,feelings song for kids,the learning station songs,feelings and emotions song for kids,kids songs,feeling song for kids
description:
Angry Song is from the award-winning CD, “Singing, Moving and Fun” 
“Singing, Moving and Fun” CD Download by The Learning Station (a.k.a. Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli. Download “Sing, Moving and Fun CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/singingmovingandfundownload.aspx
“Singing, Moving and Fun” CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/singingmovingandfun.aspx               Visit The Learning Station: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/
Visit our store!  CD’s, CD Downloads, DVD’s, Tee shirts & more: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/shop/
Angry 
★Lyrics
Angry Song  (This emotions song for children teaches them how to deal with anger.)
From the CD, “Singing, Moving and Fun” 
by The Learning Station  (a.k.a. Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli                                                             
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 

When I ask my friends to play and they say, “No, just go away.” I’m angry. I feel so angry. 
When I’m standing in a line and someone pushes from behind. I’m angry. I feel so angry. 

It’s okay if you get mad. It’s just because you’re feeling bad. It’s alright to feel that way. 
Just use words and you should say, “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” 

When I’m having lots of fun and Daddy tells me, “ Clean up son. “ I’m angry. I feel so angry. 
Kids tease me and call me “squirt”. My feelings really do get hurt. I’m angry. I feel so angry.
When I build my blocks so high and someone knocks them down, I cry. I’m angry. I feel so angry. 

Cooperation is the way to make the angries go away. So talk, don’t shout. Just work it out, and it’s okay of you should say, “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.”
“I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry.”

description:
Subitize to 10. Subitize is the ability to tell the number of objects in a set, quickly, without counting.  Subitizing develops math fluency, when students recognize sets without having to count each object and it helps develop number sense and the ability to perform mental math. Name the numbers in each set of dots, ten frames and fingers. This version  of Subitize Rock does not show the numerals after each set.

Lyrics
Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number of dots in each set)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number in the ten frames)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number of fingers)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

title: Goin' On A Treasure Hunt | Brain & Body Builder | Brain Breaks | Fun Kid's Song | Jack Hartmann
tags: Goin' On A Treasure Hunt,Treasure hunt,brain breaks,going on a treasure hunt song,treasure hunt song for kids,we're going on a treasure hunt song,going on a treasure hunt song jack hartmann,jack hartmann going on a treasure hunt,we're going on a treasure hunt,treasure hunting song,treasure hunt songs,treasure hunt for kids,treasure song,pirate song for kids,going on a bear hunt,treasure hunt song,treasure hunt music,jungle song for kids
description:
Going On a Treasure Hunt  focuses on positional and math vocabulary words as the children go on an entertaining 
treasure hunt through the jungle searching for pirates’ treasure.
Going On a Treasure Hunt  builds on a growing pattern where students apply listening and auditory skills, such as
 discriminating sounds and associating concepts, actions,
 and ideas with expressive language. This is a fun adaptation of Going on a Bear Hunt.  
Just have fun with this adventure.Help children be aware of the sequence of places & situations. Drawing pictures about this adventure would be fun - then put the drawings in the right order.

LYRICS:
Going On A Treasure Hunt 
  
Girls and boys come join me on an awesome adventure 
As we hunt in the jungle for pirates treasure
 Put on your jungle boots - shoop, shoop
 Put on your jungle hats - plop, plop, plop
 Now, your cool jungle sunglasses - cool 
Alright, mon - let’s go! 

 Chorus
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ through the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
“Look down below” ... it’s Creepy Creek 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
“Look to the right” ... it’s a field of lions sleeping ... 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh -  
 
“Look to the left” ... it’s a tunnel ... 
Something’s jing-jangling ... under my feet ...
 It’s the treasure ... 
There’s a tap on my back ... 
Aye Matey, I see you found my treasure... 
Do you know whose treasure it is-?
Whew back to the jungle shack ...
 We went on a treasure hunt ... And we weren’t afraid!

title: Name the Shape Game  | Shape Review Game | Jack Hartmann
tags: shape naming song,shape naming song for kids,name the shape song,geometry song for kids,name the shape,naming shapes song,shape names for kids,shape names for kindergarten,naming shapes kindergarten,name of basic shapes,shape naming song for kindergarten,name the shape game,shapes jack hartmann,shapes song,shape song,shape song for kids,shape song for preschool,shape song for kindergarten,shape songs,circle,square,triangle
description:
Name the Shape Game makes naming shapes fun in this game show format.  Jack Hartmann shows the shape and asks students to identify the shape, before he name the shape the first three times.  The last time students are asked to name the shape all on their own.  We show shapes as both illustrations and shapes in our environment. Recognizing everyday shapes in our environment is an important part of application of knowledge in identifying shapes.  Have fun and learn your shapes in this fun Name the Shape Game video.

Lyrics

I'll show a shape that's 2D

title: Make a Rhyme Make a Move | Rhyming Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartmann make a rhyme,make a rhyme make a move,make a rhyme,jack hartmann rhymin to the beat,make a rhyme make a move jack hartmann,Rhyming Discrimination,jack hartmann rhyming,rhyming words jack hartmann,Rhyming Songs,Learn to Rhyme,Jack Hartmann,rhyming words,rhyming songs for kindergarten,rhyming words for kindergarten,rhyming,jack hartmann songs,rhyming song,rhyming words song,rhyming songs for kids,rhyming jack hartmann,rhymes
description:
Help your children develop their phonological awareness (hearing the parts in words) and rhyming skills with this cool rhyming song that engages your children with movement, dance, and most importantly an opportunity to practice their awareness of words that rhyme. This song really makes rhyming fun which is so important in learning for young children. The ability to know when words rhyme is an essential listening and language skill for all children.  Many studies have shown that children who have developed their ability to know when words rhyme will have a better chance of becoming successful readers. Offering your children many opportunities to hear and practice rhyming will give them a better chance of becoming lifelong readers.
Make a Rhyme, Make a Move is a great song to use regularly to allow your children to really have   fun learning about rhyming.  This song presents two words, and children have a chance to listen and decide if the words rhyme or not. If the words rhyme then they do a cool Hip –Hop dance, and if the words don’t rhyme they get a chance to move and say - No way, no way.
 Listening for the parts of sounds in words at the beginning, middle and ending really helps children develop their phonological awareness (hearing the parts of words) skills so important in becoming a successful reader.
This song is so cool it will really help make learning about rhyming fun for all your children.
 Make a Rhyme, Make a Move includes Jack Hartmann and Rachel Smith singing together. Both Rachel and Jack show your children the different moves and dances they can do. And, this rhyming song features rhyming that is simple and easy to follow.
Studies show that having the ability to recognize and be aware of words that rhyme is a good predictor of future successful reading in the future.
Help make rhyming fun for your children and sing, dance and listen for those rhymes!

description:
Brand New Day is fun, good morning and start the day song.  This is a fun call and response song with lots of movement.  This song is a terrific way to start the day, recognize and move body parts to get ready for the day. Good morning song for kids.


LYRICS:

 – It’s a Brand New Day 
 
Activity – Start the day with this fun movement, call & response song for all ages.  Move hands, swing arms, sway hips, both hands over heart, twist feet, pat knees, touch toes  and nose and create your own movements.

Five little pumpkins sitting on a gate.
The first one said, "Oh my, it's getting late."
The second one said, "There are witches in the air."
The third one said, "But we don't care!"
The fourth one said, "Let's run and run and run."
The fifth one said, "We're ready for some fun!"
Then OOOhh went the wind, 
And out went the lights,
And the five little pumpkins rolled out of sight.

LYRICS:
There is something fun we can do when we meet.
Some are silly, some are proper ways to greet.
Stand up tall, find a friend, and stick out your right hand.
Firmly shake and look them in the eye...
Turn your head from side to side, 
Give a silly, almost proper sideways, HI!
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? It's a great day. 
I'm thankful to be with you.
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? 
I'm happy to (feel this way).- 3x
There is something fun we can do when we meet.
Some are silly, some are proper ways to greet.
Close your hand with your knuckles facing at a friend.
Now you both tap knuckles as you smile....
Turn your head from side to side, 
Give a silly, almost proper sideways, HI!
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? It's a great day. 
I'm thankful to be with you.
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? 
I'm happy to (feel this way).- 3x
There is something fun we can do when we meet.
Some are silly, some are proper ways to greet.
Right hand, to a friend's right hand, then lock your thumbs.
Flutter up and do the butterfly...
Turn your head from side to side, 
Give a silly, almost proper sideways, HI!
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? It's a great day. 
I'm thankful to be with you.
Good morning! Buenos Dias! What's up? 
I'm happy to (feel this way).- 3x

FREE curriculum - Kindness Counts: Exploring Random Acts of Kindness: http://www.tonychestnut.com/BookAboutTonyCurriculum.pdf
Bucket fillers' are those who help without being asked, give hugs and compliments, and generally spread their love and good feelings to others.  Why teach kindness?  There have been numerous studies which demonstrate the positive effects of kindness on health and well-being.  The kindness giver, receiver and even those observing the kind act immediately experience an increase in happiness, a blissful sense of euphoria, increase in energy, more optimism and a general feeling of being healthy.  Children who learn about compassion, respect, empathy and how to express acts of kindness in both words and actions, can have a positive impact on the world they live in.  It is proven that young children raised to understand the value of kindness are less likely to bully or even become violent.   
Remember you can make a difference each time you brighten someone's life through small efforts like a smile, kind word, saying thank you or showing you care. 

LYRICS

Fill Your Bucket 
From the CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs
© Monopoli/The Learning Station

Words for your word wall: "Friendship"  "Kindness" "Helpful" "Polite" "Caring" "Respect" "Empathy" "Compassion" "Sympathy" "Concern" "Sharing" 


Hold the hands of the friends on either side of you,
And don't let go at all. It's what we all should do.

Refrain: It's only holding hands but it means so much.
We're filling buckets with just a simple touch.
Let's be bucket fillers. That's what we all should be.
Our bucket is invisible. It's really make-believe.
But there's no doubt in what a kind act can do.
It makes someone feel good, then comes right back to you.

When we're nice, we fill yours too.
When we help, we fill our bucket.

description:
Animal Signs 2 by Jack Hartmann teaches the American Sign Language signs for common animals.  Engage your student's body and brain as they learn interesting facts about each animal and the ASL sign for the animal.  Learn American Sign Language for: dog, cat, bird, squirrel, horse, pig, cow and chicken in Animal Signs 2 by Jack Hartmann. Wonderful for ESL learners to learn animal names and signs. Learn about each animal and their signs as you build body and brain connections while engaging all modalities. Learn how to sign animal names with Jack Hartmann.
ASL for animals. Sign language for animals.

title: Let's Get Fit Version 2 | Count to 100  | 2020 Version | Jack Hartmann
tags: count to 100 version 2,count to 100,count to 100 song,count to 100 jack hartmann,counting to 100,counting to 100 by 1's,counting song,counting song for kindergarten,100,count to 100 everyday,jack hartmann count to 100,100 song,count to 100 by 1,let's get fit count to 100,count to 100 jack hartmann new,let's get fit,count to 100 exercise,1 to 100,count to 100 by 1's,lets get fit,lets get fit version 2,lets get fit jack hartmann,let's get fit version 2
description:
Jack Hartmann's Let's Get Fit Version 2  teaches your children to count to 100 as they get some great exercise too in this updated 2020 version of Count to 100 version 2.
 This cool, kid-friendly song starts out with a message about staying healthy and fit and having fun counting to 100 together.   It's a great count to 100 song for Kindergarten.
I show the children simple, easy to do exercises for each 10 numbers. Children have a variety of gross motor movements to do as they count to 100. 
    The songs great beat and steady counting motivate children to keep moving all the way to 100. We show the numbers  from 1 to 100 very large and clear so children also get the visual number recognition and stimulation. 
    This count to 100 song will engage your children with the catchy up tempo music, the clear numeral visuals and seeing Jack sing and demonstrate the exercises.
     Use Count to 100 - Let's Get Fit every day to strengthen your children's ability to count to 100 and help them enjoy and have fun exercising  too.
     Counting to 100 and basic number recognition is a standard in most early childhood ( pre-k, K and 1st grade)  classrooms.
This is a great math song to start your day with, as a brain break or use it during indoor recess. 
    PE Teachers will love  Count to 100 too as it emphasizes physical education and aerobic exercise as children count to 100.

title: Zero The Hero | Count to 100 | 100 Days of School | Jack Hartmann
tags: count to 100,jack hartmann,Zero The Hero,100 Days of School,count to 100 song,count by 1s count to 100 by 1s,counting to 100,100,jack hartmann count to 100,0 the hero,zero to hero,zero the hero song for kindergarten,jack hartmann zero the hero,zero hero,count to 100 everyday,counting to 100 songs for kindergarten,zero the hero song,count to 100 jack hartmann,zero the hero jack hartmann,zero the hero count to 100,jack hartman,100 song,zero
description:
Zero the Hero helps kids exercise and learn to count to 100. This is a great song to engage your children in movement and practicing how to count to 100. Also, this song is perfect to have some Zero the Hero fun to celebrate 100 days of school.

This count to 100 song features the popular fictional character Zero the Hero who flies in with Zeroes so children can count beyond the number 9. Zero the Hero places the zero (0) to hold the place for the tens (10's), hundreds (100's), thousands (1,000's) and on to infinity. Wow, those zeroes are important! Zero the Hero is a big, cool, super character that helps make math fun. At your school or home, anyone can dress up a little bit and have fun with playing the part of Zero the Hero.

Teachers and parents all over the world do dress up as Zero the Hero to help children understand how important those zeroes (0's) are to hold the place for numbers to go beyond single digit numbers.

So, count to 100 and follow Zero the Hero while exercising, getting smarter, stronger and healthier.

Just for your information, I wrote this song, but our, count to 100 Zero the Hero character, is played by our friend Mark. He was a good sport to do this, and is a really great guy. By the way, he really is that big! He bench presses almost 500 lbs, dose curls with 200 lbs, has 22 inch biceps and works out 2 hrs a day five days a week ! He's also a stay at home dad with 6 children. Wow! 

Have fun exercising with Zero the Hero and learning to count to 100.

REPEAT CHORUS TO END: Cheecha cha cha cheecha cha cha cheech cha cha. Now sway.

Activity: Have the children perform the movements described in each verse.

LYRICS:
I KNOW AN OLD LADY

I know an old lady who swallowed a fly I don’t know why she swallowed a fly (Oh me oh my)
I know an old lady who swallowed a spider that wriggled and jiggled and tickled inside her.
She swallowed the spider to catch the fly. I don’t know why she swallowed a fly (Oh me oh my)
I know an old lady who swallowed a bird. How absurd to swallow a bird.

Chorus
She swallowed the bird to catch the spider that wriggled and jiggled and tickled inside her.
She swallowed the spider to catch the fly. I don’t know why she swallowed a fly (Oh me oh my)

I know an old lady who swallowed a cat imagine that she swallowed a cat. She swallowed the cat to catch the bird.

Repeat Chorus

I know an old lady who swallowed a dog. She was a hog to swallow a dog.
She swallowed the dog to catch the cat. She swallowed the cat to catch the bird.

Repeat Chorus

I know an old lady who swallowed a goat. Opened her throat and swallowed a goat.
She swallowed the goat to catch the dog. She swallowed the dog to catch the cat.
She swallowed the cat to catch the bird.

Repeat Chorus

I know an old lady who swallowed a cow.  I don’t know how she swallowed a cow.
She swallowed the cow to catch the goat. She swallowed the goat to catch the dog
She swallowed the dog to catch the cat. She swallowed the cat to catch the bird.

Repeat Chorus

I know an old lady who swallowed a horse, a horse?
Do you think it’s really possible to swallow a horse?
No way....

description:
What's your favourite fruit? Sing and dance along with Mimi and Gabi to this fun cha cha celebrating fruit!
A song that teaches children that eating fruit is a yummy (and healthy) sweet treat!
This song would also be a great #brainbreak for preschool and kindergarten kids.

title: Kids Fitness - Star Wars Baby Yoda  - Brain Break Toddler Learning
tags: Baby Yoda,brain breaks for preschool,brain break,robotots,star wars workout,preschool activities,jedi exercise,kids activities at home,indoor activities for kids,youtube kids,Star Wars,star wars kids,robotots disney,kids workout,yoga for kids,kid friendly,jedi training,family,kids yoga,family vlogger,family vloggers,disney,family vlog,kids,disney creator days,robotots family,robotots star wars,robo tots,kids workout robotots
description:
Star Wars fans! We created a special Star Wars kids show for your toddlers and kids about your favorite Star Wars characters and places. Move like C3PO, blast off like the Millennium Falcon, dodge the asteroids, yoga pose like #babyyoda and enjoy a fun skit with RoboDad as Kylo Ren training you from the Dark Side. If your children like to move and jump or if they already do kids yoga, they will love RoboTots fitness adventures. 

Learn coordination, balance and build your child’s confidence. Watch your children get better each time they complete new moves. If your kids are shy in group classes, start with RoboTots. This is a great way to have fun and develop skills right in your own home. Kids can be silly and jump around without the added pressure of other kids in the class or a new environment. 

15 fun and easy moves for your little kids who love Disney and Star Wars! This fun Star Wars workout will get your kids jumping and dancing. Watch the timer- Kids love to earn stars and diamonds as they complete each exercise move for 15 seconds. Lots of fun music and graphics for kids to see. 

RoboTots creates Family Friendly Content for parents and educators. Kids can enjoy these fun videos while learning the importance of being active at a young age.

Your kids can have fun with these simple exercise moves. Great ideas for brain breaks at school and indoor activities for home or the classroom.

FITNESS for Kids
:35 X-Wing Fighter Jumping Jacks
1:00 Chewbacca Lunges
1:30 C3PO robot dance
2:01 R2D2 Move
2:36 AT-AT walk
3:05 Storm Trooper March
3:35 Kylo Ren 
4:45 Halftime RoboTots Team
5:10 Millennium Falcon Jump
5:40 Dodge the Asteroids
6:22 Tie Fighter flying
6:47 Frozen in Carbonite
7:10 Death Star twist
7:41 Jedi Training Use the Force
8:08 Star Wars Cantina Dance
8:32 Baby Yoda Meditation

9:38 LEARNING ADVENTURE
After the RoboTots kids Star Wars workout, blast off to Star Wars Land for a kids educational tour of Galaxy's Edge in Disneyland. The city of Batuu at Galaxys edge is so realistic. There are storm troopers, scoundrels and Jedi roaming around, so we must be very careful. The Star Wars learning adventure starts with the Millennium Falcon and we learn to count to 12 parsecs. Our preschool age son is a big Star Wars fan. First we took him on the Millennium Falcon ride at Disneyland Galaxys Edge. Next we found the Droid Depot at Star Wars land and learned how to build our very own droid. R-series or BB unit. We chose the R series like R2-D2. Learn about colors, pick your favorite parts and put it together. The activated droid communicates with other droids in Disneyland Star Wars land. Next we see a sign in a foreign language. We learn about Aurebesh the mythical language of Star Wars. We check out the milk stand. Have you ever tried blue or green milk? Watch how RoboDad drinks the milk. We had so much fun showing you around Disneyland Galaxy Edge for kids! We hope you enjoyed the educational adventure. May the force be with you!

10:21 Counting to 12 parsecs
10:50 Millennium Falcon Ride at Star Wars land
11:44 Building a droid at the Droid Depot
13:26 Aurebesh Language of Star Wars
13:54 Blue and Green Milk - Milk Stand Galaxy's Edge

Please join our Instagram and Facebook page to connect with us and share your experiences. We want to see photos/video of your kids doing the exercises. Use #robotots for a feature on the @robotots Instagram.

Don’t forget to SUBSCRIBE!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCINWamNPjQkTKz78hZM7tiQ?sub_confirmation=1

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ0EeFHqhnC4_R0STQ41MCxiwiL9hHC6Q

RoboTots Family Vlog Playlist
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ0EeFHqhnC6TUNapqmj6oexUVg7sbSb5

Hi there! New to RoboTots? If so, here's what you need to know -- We like kids activities a LOT, so we use this channel to explore kids exercise, toddler activities, and family vacations with kids, to inspire you to live an active family life.

Join our growing RoboTots community today! Find us on Instagram.

title: Brain Break: Stretching
description:
Join the Strong4Life Challenge Team as they lead a stretching brain break activity that you can do anywhere.

Learning is important, but it's difficult to learn something new when we're tired or low on energy. Encourage your child(ren) to recharge their brain and body by taking regular breaks throughout the school day to do something active. Not only are brain breaks fun, but they make it easier to focus and learn.

And remember to help keep yourself and others safe by practicing the 3 W's: wear a mask, wash your hands and watch your distance.

title: Phonics Song | Letter Sounds | Letter Sounds Workout | Alphabet Song | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartmann alphabet workout,jack hartmann,letter sounds,jack hartmann letter sounds,phonics song,alphabet song,letter sounds for kindergarten,jack hartman,phonics songs for kindergarten,alphabet songs for kindergarten,phonics songs,alphabet workout,jack hartmann songs,alphabet aerobics,phonics,letter song,alphabet sounds,letter songs,abc workout,letter sounds jack hartmann,letter sound workout,alphabet songs,lettercise,letter sound song
description:
Letter Sound Workout engages your children physically and academically as they learn their letter sounds.Learn the letter sounds with our exercise to the  letter sound song, Letter Sounds Workout. 

Educational studies have shown that movement and exercise increase oxygen to the brain for improved active learning. Your children will love doing this song over and over because it actively engages them with what they are learning. We keep the movements very simple so all children can easily participate. Letting our children experience learning with their brain and body helps them make deeper emotional, interpersonal and kinesthetic connections to the academic subject. According to Harvard Medical School’s Professor John Ratey, in a 2008 Education Week article, “physical exercise puts the brain of the child in the optimal position for learning.”

I say the letter sounds very clearly and accurately. I don't extend additional sounds to the individual sound of each letter. Your children follow my suggested movements as they say the letter, the sound and a word beginning with the letter. 

Teachers and reading specialists have guided us to say the letter sound before the word for your children to hear the initial letter sound starting the word. Our only exception is the using the word fox with the letter x, because the x in fox accurately makes the (ks – sound). Let your children have fun exercising and learning their letter sounds with Letter Sounds Workout.

Actively participating in this song daily will help your class achieve the Common Core and national standard of learning one to one letter sound correspondence.

Lyrics
Girls and boys get ready to sing and move about
We can learn the letter sounds as we all workout
Stretch up high to the sky- workout, workout
Tap your knees to the beat-  workout, workout
Twist your hips just like this-  workout, workout

title: Let's Learn About the Clock | Fun Clock Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
tags: learn the clock,learn the clock for kids,lets learn about the clock,fun clock song,fun clock song for kids,clock song,learn the clock song,learn to tell time,clock song for kids,clock song for kindergarten,clock song for first grade,jack hartmann,anolog clock,learn the analog clock,analog clock song,analog clock song for kids,telling time,telling time song,jack hartman,jack hartmann songs,clock kids,jack hartmann clock,clock,telling time for kids
description:
Learn about the clock and telling time in this fun Let's Learn About the Clock song.   Let's Learn About the Clock teaches about the numbers on the clock, the minute hand, the hour hand and how they move around the clock. Let's Learn About the Clock is a great introduction to telling time.   This analog clock song helps children learn how to tell time on an analog clock.
 
Lyrics
Tick- tock let's learn about the clock
Tick-tock the analog clock

You see them on your wall 
In the classroom or the hall
A lot of people wear them on their wrist
It's the analog clock

Now sing after me and let's learn about the analog clock
Analog clocks can be the shape of a circle
Analog clocks can be the shape of a circle
The numbers on the clock go from 1 to 12
The numbers on the clock go from 1 to 12
A short hand and long hand go round and round
A short hand and long hand go round and round
Both hands go round both day and night
Both hands go round both day and night
And we always say O'clock on the hour
A short hand tells the hours on the clock
A short hand tells the hours on the clock
A short hand moves one number each hour
A short hand moves one number each hour
A long hand tells the minutes on the clock
A long hand tells the minutes on the clock
A long hand goes all around each hour
A long hand goes all around each hour
And we always say O'clock on the hour

Tick- tock let's learn about the clock
Tick-tock the analog clock
Tick- tock let's learn about the clock
Tick-tock the analog clock

tags: here we go jack hartmann,directions song,directions song for kids,spatial awareness song,positional words song for kindergarten,direction song for kids,direction song for children,direction songs for kids,positional words for kindergarten,directions for kids,positional language song for children,kids songs,kids videos,jack hartmann positional words,Here we go,spacial awareness,jack hartmann,kids music,following directions song,here we go directions song
description:
In our Here We Go video children can practice learning spatial concepts and positional words as they sing, move and have fun together. The concept of opposites can also be introduced as I move in opposite directions.  Have your children stand up, sing along with me and follow my movements  - up, down, side to side, round and round ...  The great rhythm and beat will motivate them to move right along with me.
  
I am a strong believer in all the benefits of fitness and exercise and getting children to enjoy moving their bodies' everyday. So, I try to write songs that incorporate the learning standards they need to meet and great exercise too.
 
Here We Go is a simple, fun, movement and spatial awareness song you can do everyday. Have fun with it  - always my hope for little ones.

Lyrics

Here we go down, down, down, down
