title: Nursery Rhymes | Nursery Rhymes Song | Brain Breaks | Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartmann,brain breaks,children's songs,educational songs,children's music,kids music,kids videos,kids songs,Nursery Rhymes,Nursery Rhymes Song,Brain Breaks,Twinkle,Twinkle Little Star,twinkle twinkle little star,jack hartmann twinkle twinkle little star,twinkle twinkle little star jack hartmann,twinkle twinkle little star jack,jack hartmann nursery rhymes,jack hartmann twinkle,twinkle twinkle little star jack hartman,twinkle twinkle little star siong
description:
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star is a traditional poem or song for young children. The repetition  and rhyming in Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star is helpful in teaching kids how language development works. Kids love to sing and dance along with the Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star with all the characters they know and love.

Nursery Rhymes help with a child’s language development. Kids hear and say vowel and letter sounds repeatedly throughout the song, Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star.   Nursery rhymes are filled with alliteration. As they sing a nursery rhyme they get a sense for rhythm and can help develop other important language skills such as inflection.
 
Nursery Rhymes are also important as they are often where a child hears a word for the first time, building their vocabulary. Nursery rhymes are also a great introduction to sentence and story structure because they are short and easy to remember, making them repeatable, too. Nursery rhymes are good for simple story telling as they usually have an identifiable beginning, middle and end. Kids easily memorize and recall the stories, especially when the nursery rhymes are set to music.

Nursery rhymes can build a child’s imagination as they need to visualize and often act out scenes in the nursery rhymes. Humpty Dumpty is a great example. Nursery rhymes such as Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star can help kids with developing gross and fine motor movements.

What you may not know is nursery rhymes can also help develop math skills as well. Many nursery rhymes involve the use of number, such as three blind mice, but also nursery rhymes rely on patterning and sequence. Math vocabulary words for measurement can also be introduced, for instance weight. Research also supports the assertion that music and rhyme increase a child's ability in spatial reasoning.

Nursery rhymes also aid kids in developing socially as the characters in nursery rhymes are often portrayed in a variety of situations. These situations teach children about understanding their emotions and the emotion of others and how to identify what these emotions are.

LYRICS:
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star

Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky

title: Brain Break: Lions Breath
description:
Hey kids, 

This is a breathing technique called Lions Breath. Start by kneeling with your bum flat on the bottom of your feet. Breath in slowly through the nose and out quickly through the mouth making the "HA" sound. Repeat as many time as necessary. 

-Mr Lynch

title: DISNEY Kids FITNESS RoboTots Kids YouTube FROZEN Disney fans
tags: Frozen,frozen 2,Robotots,Disney creators,robotots disney,robo tots,robotots fitness,Kids youtube,Kids fitness video,Kids workout video,Kids exercise songs,Kids exercise video,Kids yoga youtube,Kids yoga videos,Kids yoga class,kids video for toddlers,Activity to keep kids busy,Activities to keep kids active,Indoor activities for toddlers,Indoor activities for kids,disney family,disney,robotots kids,get moving with disney,frozen,disney kids fitness
description:
Calling all Disney fans! Toy Story, Cars, The Little Mermaid, Frozen. RoboTots created a special Disney kids show for your toddlers and kids about your favorite Disney movie characters. Dance like Mickey, race like Lightning McQueen, wiggle like Ursula, spin like Elsa and enjoy a funny skit with RoboDad from Toy Story. If your children like to move and jump or if they already do kids yoga, they will love RoboTots fitness adventures. 

Learn coordination, balance and build your child’s confidence. Watch your children get better each time they complete new moves. If your kids are shy in group classes, start with RoboTots. This is a great way to have fun and develop skills right in your own home. Kids can be silly and jump around without the added pressure of other kids in the class or a new environment. 

15 fun and easy moves for your little kids who love Disney movies, Toy Story, Cars, Little Mermaid and Frozen! This fun Disney workout will get your kids jumping and dancing. Watch the timer- Kids earn stars and diamonds as they complete each exercise move for 15 seconds. Lots of fun music and graphics for kids to see. 

RoboTots creates Family Friendly Content for parents and educators. Kids can enjoy these fun videos while learning the importance of being active at a young age.

Your kids can have fun with these simple exercise moves. Great ideas for brain breaks at school and indoor activities for home or the classroom.

FITNESS for Kids
:37 Mickey Mouse hot dog dance
1:00 Minnie Mouse ice skating dance
1:37 Lightning McQueen driving
2:04 Cars Flag arm waving
2:28 Mater walk backwards
3:00 Slinky Dog yoga plank
3:28 Buzz Lightyear Flying balance
4:42 Toy Story Woody’s Roundup move
5:36 Sebastian Walk
6:02 Ursula Dance
6:26 The Little Mermaid yoga pose
7:00 Frozen Anna jumping jacks
7:25 Elsa Ice Power Spin
7:55 Olaf Happy Dance
8:18 Olaf snow cloud

9:20 LEARNING ADVENTURE
Disney on Ice brings the magic of Disney to your home town. Our daughter loves Frozen and we can't wait for Frozen 2, so we were looking for a show with Elsa and Anna. We are so happy we went to Oakland CA for Disney on Ice - Worlds of Enchantment. It was even better than we imagined!

We met up with a professional Disney on Ice figure skater, Morgan, who gave us some great information for kids interested in ice skating. Then we met the stars of the show, Mickey and Minnie at the Disney Blogger event. The tots loved the Olaf and Mickey collectible cups, Elsa and Mickey glow sticks and the whole experience. The show starts off with Minnie and Mickey, Donald and Goofy. We see Andy and all the beloved toys of Toy Story, Woody, Jessie, Buzz. The next act is Little Mermaid with Ariel, Sebastian, Ursula and Flounder. After the intermission we see Lightening McQueen, Mater and all the favorites from Disney's Cars. The show ends with an amazing performance by the characters in Frozen! Our favorites, Elsa, Anna, Olaf and Kristoff skate around Arendell and everyone sings Let it Go! Our 3 and 4 year old kids were fascinated by Disney on Ice the entire time! Check out the upcoming shows in your area. You won't want to miss it!

Thank you so much to Feld Entertainment and Atherton PR for inviting us to Disney on Ice!

Please join RoboTots Instagram page to connect with us and share your experiences. We want to see photos/video of your kids doing the exercises. Use #robotots and tag @robotots for a feature on Instagram.

Don’t forget to SUBSCRIBE!

Join our growing RoboTots community today! Find us on Instagram.

title: Deal or No Deal Would you Rather Halloween PARTY - Get Kids Moving
tags: Inside Recess,PE at HOME,PE warm up,Warm up for kids,fitness for kids,brain break for kids,study break for kids,PE,Physical Education,Halloween Stations
description:
This is ALL the fun in one video!!!!

Would you Rather and Deal and No Deal!!

A choice will pop up while you are resting with an exercise.  You have to decide if you want to do that choice.

If your answer is “YES, DEAL!” that means you are taking the deal and will do that move when the next slide pops up and your 30 seconds of exercise starts.

If you do NOT want that choice then another choice will pop up when it is time to exercise.  That is called NO DEAL!

The No Deal choice will pop up and you will see what it is. You will also see your dance move or exercise for the 30 seconds of exercise.

What will you decide?  Be HONEST and HAVE FUN!

title: Meditation for Kids | The Butterfly Kids' Meditation | Breethe
tags: kids' meditation,meditation for kids,children's meditation,meditation for children OMG. I Can Meditate!,Lynne Goldberg,meditation,mediation,free meditation,Wellness,Headspace,meditation app,meditation for beginners,meditation coach,OMG. I Can Meditate!
description:
This meditation is for kids.
---
Life is hard. People are soft. But we’re meant to be. Because even when stress, anxiety, or sleepless nights leave you feeling deflated, Breethe can help you bounce back to your natural, happy state. Enjoy Breethe anytime, anywhere on your phone, tablet, or computer. It's free to try, for as long as you like! 

Web: www.breethe.com 
IOS: bit.ly/breetheios 
Android: bit.ly/breetheandroid

Breethe App is your all-day (and night!) inner wellness partner for anxiety, stress, sleep, and more. You can find guided meditations for real-life situations, music for every mood, personalized recommendations, and a learn to meditate program to get you started.

Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/breetheapp
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/breetheapp
Follow us on Instagram: https://instagram.com/breetheapp

--- Guided Meditation Script
"Make your body comfortable, and when you’re ready, close your eyes

Let’s start by taking a few deep breaths.

Feel the air filling your tummy as you take a deep breath in thru your nose,

And make a big “aaaah” sound as you let the air out your mouth,

And each time you breathe out, feel your whole body becoming loose and floppy....

Take a few more big breaths like this

Now, you can start breathing normally again,

In and out thru your nose

When you breathe in, think about the word “In”,

And when you breathe out, think about the word “Out”,

Can you hear these words inside your head just by thinking about them, 

without making any sound with your mouth,

not even moving your tongue or your lips,

Let’s do this a bit longer,

Thinking about the word “In” when you breathe in,

And thinking about the word “Out” when you breathe out,

Feel how your stomach gets full like a balloon when you breathe in,

And gets smaller again when you let the air out

Now imagine that you are lying out on the grass in a beautiful park

The sun is shining and your eyes are closed

Just relaxing in the sunshine

As you lie there, a very friendly butterfly comes to say hello to you

Can you imagine this butterfly?  It can be any colour you choose

The butterfly is fluttering its wings just above your toes....

If you really pay attention, can you feel the soft breeze from the butterfly's wings on your toes?

Now the butterfly is floating along your legs to your knees.... 

Can you feel a little tingling feeling from its wings on your legs?

If you can’t feel anything, just imagine what it would feel like if you could,

Now the butterfly is fluttering its wings as it moves up to your belly button....

Can you feel it tickling your belly as it flies around?

Try to imagine what the butterfly’s wings look like?

Maybe you can see them, and feel them fluttering at the same time in your imagination?

Now the butterfly is floating up and down your arms,

From your shoulder to your hands and back

Feel it with your imagination as it flies up and down each arm, 

And now, just before flying off, the butterfly is coming to wish you a beautiful day,

As it flutters its wings just above your forehead!

See it floating there in your mind,

Feel the fluttering of its wings

If you listen very closely, you might be able to hear them flutter,

And now, off it flies..

Leaving you feeling very warm and cozy,

Just lying in the sunshine... 

Now, let’s just sit quietly and breathe for just a bit longer until you hear the bell."

Education is the key to success. The main purpose of this channel is to provide a stimulating online learning environment for kids of all ages. 
A learning environment that encourages community,  acts as a guide for parents and promotes the individual skills as well as confidence in each child.

Throughout my teaching experience, I have found that children earn best when actively engaged and provided with multiple forms of instruction. I am excited to provide an enriched educational experience to children from all over the world.

description:
See Laurie LIVE at her Virtual Family Concerts! live.laurieberkner.com

Calling all superheroes! What's a simple way you can help save the world? By wearing your superhero mask, of course! Kids can change the lyrics to describe their own superhero masks.

Are you an educator and want to incorporate songs like this into your classroom? Watch Laurie Berkner's free "Music in the Classroom" seminars: https://laurieberkner.com/music-in-the-classroom

Lyrics: 
This is my superhero mask
It keeps us both safe
My mask is blue
And I wear it on my face
It covers up my chin and nose and mouth
So the germs don't go in
And the germs don't go out
If you want to be a superhero like me
Just put on a superhero mask

title: Water Cycle | Brain and Body Builders | Jack Hartmann
tags: Learning Science,Water Cycle,Educational Songs,Childrens Songs,Kids Songs,Brain Breaks,Brain and Body Builders,Jack Hartmann,jack hartmann water cycle,water cycle jack hartmann,water cycle song jack hartmann,water cycle song,jack hartman water cycle,the water cycle song,water cycle for kids,water cycle jack hartman,the water cycle,the water cycle goes round and round song,water cycle sing along,water cycle song for kids,jack hartmann the water cycle
description:
Learn about the water cycle and the three (3) stages of the water cycle; evaporation, condensation and precipitation. The Water Cycle is focused on the physical science topic of learning the three essential phases of the water cycle. Children sing along and can follow with movements and motions showing how the cycle goes round and round. The song includes a simple rap for each phase that describes the specific process in each phase. Your children will get all the basics about the water cycle’s 3 phases by listening to Jack’s song, Water Cycle.

LYRICS:
The Water Cycle –it goes around and round (Chorus)
The Water Cycle –keeps going up and down
The Water Cycle –it goes around and round,
 It goes around and round and round

Evaporation, condensation, precipitation
Keeps going round and round (repeat)
Keeps going round and round, and round

Evaporation –Happens first
The sun heats surface waters of the earth
The water’s changed to a gas right there
Gets lighter and rises into the air

Condensation –Is when the gas
Gets cooled in the upper atmosphere
Turns liquid or solid forming clouds
And, yo, it might start falling down

Precipitation –Is when the clouds
Get liquids or solids all around
The particles get heavy and grow
Then fall as rain, hail, sleet or snow

Repeat Chorus

The water cycle it keeps going round and round and round

title: 15 COOL BRAIN GAMES THAT'LL TRAIN YOUR MIND
tags: riddles,brain teasers,riddles with answers,brain teasers with answers,test your brain,puzzles,7-Second Riddles,brain games,brain teasers for kids,tricky riddle,logic riddle,short riddle,nice tricks,brain games for adults,funny riddle,cool riddle,brain puzzles,logic puzzle,test your logic,riddles for kids,riddles for adults
description:
These 15 cool and fun brain games will help you train your mind and get it ready to crack any problem at work, school or personal life:

00:14 - Brain teasers for kids and adults - Tricky riddle.
This tricky riddle will gently warm up your brain and wake you up. It's not an simple task to be a Mom or a Dad; kids often throw some puzzles your way. If you easily cracked this one, you're either a parent or a true genius (yeah, all parents are a bit superhuman)!
01:21 - Logic riddle - Short riddle.
Would you suspect something is wrong if the whole class always know the correct answers? To be honest, I wouldn't🤓 But there's really something strange in this situation. The clever teacher came up with a nice trick and almost cheated the inspector! Will you crack this mystery riddle and reveal the truth before the inspector leaves the school?
02:30 - Brain games for adults.
This brain-itching riddle will be a perfect warm-up for your brain especially when you've just woken up! All you need to do is examine carefully the names of the other children and find out what they have in common. If you fail, it means you're still sleeping, so you'd better splash cold water on your face and try another one!
03:26 - Tricky riddle - Funny riddle.
Only the smartest and wisest people can solve this tricky riddle. It's actually about practical wisdom and doesn't require any special knowledge. You'll certainly solve it if you use your logic and life experience. Anyway, even if you fail, just wait for the answer at the end of the video. A cool riddle with answer to challenge your friends! 
04:27 - Can you think outside the box? - Cool riddle to test your brain.
This tricky riddle may seem impossible to solve, but all you need to do is to turn on your brain and think logically. Most people fail to find the answer, but I think you will be among those few people who crack this riddle like a nut😉 Anyway, it's a riddle with answer, so you can riddle your friends later on!
05:57 - Brain games that'll break your heads.
06:50 - Cool brain puzzles.
Cool brain puzzles to boost your logical thinking and wake your brain up! You really need to stretch your brain a bit and turn on your logic to crack these three puzzles. I failed to solve the second and third one, and when I saw the answers, it was just WOW, IT'S SO OBVIOUS! Tell me, how many of them you've solved!
08:02 - Logic puzzle.
This short riddle to test your logic and common sense! How will you match these bulbs to their switches if you can't even see what's going on in the room? A funny riddle with answer that will definitely help you keep your mind sharp. Write "Eureka!" in the comments if you have found the solution before I revealed the answer! 
09:45 - Funny riddles for kids that most adults fail.
11:06 - Tricky riddle - Brain games.
This riddle will trick you hard and fast! Which letter comes next? Only if you are capable of simplifying things and putting logic into that, you'll figure the answer easily! The last riddle is left for you to crack, so TELL me IN THE COMMENTS your answers 🤗

TELL me IN THE COMMENTS how many of these brain games you managed to solve before the time was up!

Subscribe to 7-Second Riddles: https://goo.gl/BZSTVh

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/7second.riddles/
Website: https://brightside.me/wonder-quizzes/

http://www.brightside.me/

title: Brain Breaks | Nursery Rhymes | Nursery Rhymes Song | Pease Porridge | Jack Hartmann
tags: jack hartmann,brain breaks,children's songs,educational songs,kids music,kids videos,kids songs,Nursery Rhymes,Nursery Rhymes Song,Pease Porridge,Pease Porridge Hot,Pease Porridge Cold,Pease Porridge Song,peas porridge hot,peas porridge hot jack hartmann,pease porridge hot nursery rhyme,peas porridge hot nursery rhyme,jack hartmann nursery rhymes,peas porridge,peas porridge hot with action,jack hartmann peas porridge hot,jack hartmann nursery rhyme
description:
Peas Porridge is a traditional poem or song for young children. The repetition in Peas Porridge is helpful in teaching kids how language works. Kids love to sing and dance along with the Peas Porridge with all the characters they know and love.

Nursery Rhymes help with a child’s language development. Kids hear and say vowel and letter sounds repeatedly throughout the song, Peas Porridge.   Nursery rhymes are filled with alliteration. As they sing a nursery rhyme they get a sense for rhythm and can help develop other important language skills such as inflection. 

Nursery Rhymes are also important as they are often where a child hears a word for the first time, building their vocabulary. Nursery rhymes are also a great introduction to sentence and story structure because they are short and easy to remember, making them repeatable, too. Nursery rhymes are good for simple story telling as they usually have an identifiable beginning, middle and end. Kids easily memorize and recall the stories, especially when the nursery rhymes are set to music.

Nursery rhymes can build a child’s imagination as they need to visualize and often act out scenes in the nursery rhymes. Humpty Dumpty is a great example. Nursery rhymes such as Peas Porridge can help kids with developing gross and fine motor movements.

What you may not know is nursery rhymes can also help develop math skills as well. Many nursery rhymes involve the use of number, such as three blind mice, but also nursery rhymes rely on patterning and sequence. Math vocabulary words for measurement can also be introduced, for instance weight. Research also supports the assertion that music and rhyme increase a child's ability in spatial reasoning.

Nursery rhymes also aid kids in developing socially as the characters in nursery rhymes are often portrayed in a variety of situations. These situations teach children about understanding their emotions and the emotion of others and how to identify what these emotions are.

LYRICS:

Pease Porridge

Peas porridge hot, peas porridge cold
Peas porridge in the pot 9 days old
Some like it hot, some like it cold
Some like it in the pot 9 days old.

1, 2, 3, 4 & 5
6, 7, 8, then the next number is 9.

Peas porridge hot, peas porridge cold
Peas porridge in the pot 9 days old
Some like it hot, some like it cold
Some like it in the pot 9 days old.

1, 2, 3, 4 & 5
6, 7, 8, then the next number is 9.

tags: jack hartmann peanut butter,jack hartmann peanut butter song,jack hartmann peanut butter and jelly,educational songs,peanut butter and jelly song for children,finger plays,fingerplays,jack hartmann,peanut butter and jelly,peanut butter,jelly,brain breaks,peanut butter song,peanut butter jelly,peanut butter jelly song,peanut butter and jelly song,peanut butter jelly song for children,peanut butter jelly time,peanut butter and jelly jack hartmann
description:
This Peanut Butter and Jelly song has a kid friendly cool beat children love. They'll want to do this song over and over again because it's just a fun repeat - after - me song that's so easy to do. 

I show the children the movements as they sing each line after me. Dig the peanuts, crack the shells, mash the peanuts, spread the peanut butter. They continue to finger play and pick the grapes, squish the grapes, spread the jelly and eat the sandwich.

Teachers can use the song as a simple, quick and easy brain breaks activity to help get a short break and feel refreshed to continue schoolwork.

This finger play has a great beat and the words are sung clearly so that children can easily repeat the words and do the movement.

Enjoy the Peanut Butter and Jelly Finger Play regularly with your little ones.

tags: subitize,math song for kids,counting song for kids,math song,subitize song for kindergarten,subitize kindergarten,subitize song,number pairs,jack hartmann,jack hartman,math fluency,visualizing a set,quick images,visualizing the set,visualizing sets,automaticity,math automaticity,number automaticity,subitization,subitizing,subitization song,subitizing song,subitize to 5,subitize up to 5,subitizing in kindergarten,subitizing to 5,subitize jack hartmann
description:
Subitize is the ability to tell the number of objects in a set, quickly, without counting.  In this subitizing song  name the numbers in each set of dots, ten frames and fingers. Subitizing develops math fluency, when students recognize sets without having to count each object and it helps develop number sense and the ability to perform mental math. In this version we subitize up to 5 and then give the answer for reinforcement. Have fun subitizing with this subitize song.

title: Toe Tapper Energizing Brain Break
tags: energizing brain break,break,brain break,brain
description: Energizing Brain Breaks are quick 1-2 minute activities for your classroom.  They take virtually no preparation and no extra materials to perform.  Students of all ages love them. Why do they love them?  Because they are fun and make you laugh.  They also challenge your brain.  Energizing Brain Breaks help you to cross the mid-line of your body which helps both sides of your brain engage.  It is suggested to use an Energizing Brain Break every 30 minutes with your class.  They are terrific during exams and standardized tests.  Just give an Energizing Brain Break between sections of tests or even right in the middle of the test.  If you would like to see some in action, go to www.energizingbrainbreaks.com.   The Energizing Brain Breaks book is laminated; spiral bound, and has 50 activities on card stock paper.  The ISBN number is 978-0-578-05058-4 and is a $14.95 value.

title: Brain Break -Scavenger Hunt
description:
Scavenger Hunt
I will give you 3 separate lists with items that you generally will have in and around your house.
The lists will pop up on the screen for 10 second and then you will have to see if you can find the items in under 3 minutes per list.
What do you need?
Plastic container or a basket. Any container will do, it does not need to be a big container.
And then a stopwatch. You will use the stopwatch to time yourself. You will have 3 minutes to complete a list.

You will have 10 sec to view a list that will pop up on screen. After 10 sec the screen will turn red and you will have to press pause.
Once you press pause you will start your stopwatch.
You then go on your 1st scavenger hunt. You have 3 minutes to complete the list. If you can’t find an item in under 3 minutes, don’t worry you will be able to look for that item during the other 2 hunts.
After 3 minutes you must return to your screen and press play so view your 2nd list.
Feel free to ask you parents for help as 3 minutes is a short time.
Repeat the process. In total there is 15 items on the lists. You score will be the total number of items that you have in your container/ basket at the end of the video.

Well done and I hope you found all the items on the lists
Remember to like this video and subscribe to our channel.

tags: Holiday Song for Kids,Holiday Song,DJ Jingle,christmas song,christmas,jack hartmann,jack hartmann christmas,jack hartmann christmas songs,holiday songs for kids,jack hartmann holiday,christmas jack hartmann,jack hartman christmas songs,christmas brain breaks for kids,dj jingle jack hartmann,fun holiday songs for kids,gingerbread man song jack hartmann,holidays song for kids,jack hartman christmas,jack hartmann dj jingle,christmas movement songs for kids
description:
This holiday song for kids gets your kids dancing in different styles and having lots fun together!  DJ Jingle is a holiday song for kids that features five holiday characters your kids will love: DJ Jingle, the Gingerbread Man, the Candy Cane Girl, Snazzy the Snowman and Ruby the Reindeer.

Each holiday character will engage your kids to follow them doing fun dance moves they will love to do over and over again!

DJ Jingle is a holiday song for kids that features music that kids and adults of all ages will enjoy. It can be used as a great brain breaks song for kids and is even perfect for PE classes to get everyone moving and dancing.

DJ Jingle is also a wonderful song to sing along with in the car while traveling during those holiday trips. The super catchy melody to this holiday song will help lift everyone's spirit at this special holiday time of the year, or anytime of the year!

LYRICS:
DJ Jingle

DJ Jingle, you make us wiggle
You get everybody dancing on the floor
                      DJ Jingle, you make us wiggle          Chorus
You play the hits at holiday time

Snazzy the snowman, he can really groove
He’s got his own snowman dance, it’s really cool
He’s smooth as ice from his head to his feet
Snazzy the snowman, he moves right to the beat, celebrate

Ruby the reindeer is a dancing star
Her famous dance moves are known near and far
When DJ Jingle plays a holiday song
Ruby gets the whole world to dance right along, celebrate

(Chorus)

The gingerbread man he can bust a move
Hip-hop, criss-cross and cabbage patch, too
He can even dance and do the bop
Hey gingerbread man give it all you’ve got, celebrate

Candy Cane girl, oh you’re so very sweet
Watching you dance, is a candy cane treat
You go girl, go feel the DJ play
We’re having so much fun at our holiday party, celebrate

When DJ Jingle drops the beat
Everybody gets up on their feet
Dancing, smiling, having a good time
He makes the holidays happy and bright

(Chorus)

title: Sidney the Snake. Favourite animal song from kindyRock - great songs for little kids
tags: kids music,children songs,kindyrock,judi cranston,favourite nursery songs,kids songs,kindergarten music,songs for toddlers,children's music,brain breaks,snake song,kids animal song,animal songs,frog song,crocodile song,elephant song
description:
☆☆☆
Sidney the Snake. Favourite animal song from kindyRock - great songs for little kids.

“Sidney the Snake” is a huge favourite song with preschoolers and toddlers. It’s a fun, action song for children that uses lots of animals and that they love to sing and dance along to.  It's a super easy song to sing along to and also super easy as an action and movement song for kids. With a snake the slithers, a frog that jumps, a seagull that flies, an elephant that sways and a crocodile that snaps along!


Kids love to sing and dance and move along with action songs just for children.  “Sidney the Snake” really is a great animal song. With actions and movement to suit every child’s ability.

Sing along with kindyRock creator Judi Cranston and her young friend Imogen, as she takes you through simple actions of 5 favourites animals and the way they move their bodies. The tempo gets slower at the end too, making this so much fun to sing along to. Help your children to be creative by showing them how to make up their own actions, learn new language and of course TO HAVE FUN! Children love to sing and dance to their own songs as well as kindyRock songs.

If you have landed on this Youtube channel it’s probably because you are a teacher to children aged under 7 years, you've heard about us through a school, kindergarten, daycare, yoga or music class, you're an in home educator or a parent who understands the importance of music education for children's development.  

At kindyRock we want to help support you in your teaching by providing you with Quality Music Education Resources.

As a teacher you will probably know how important and effective music is for our children’s brains and that you should be doing music regularly, even on a daily basis in your classes! If you don't feel comfortable singing, that's where we make it easy for you, guiding you and the children through these easy to remember songs, designed to support you and their learning needs.

Your children will love using their voices to sing , their hands to do the actions and their eyes to follow along with Judi Cranston. Your kids will have a blast with this exciting, silly and fun song! You can incorporate and encourage your children to join in which also helps them with rhythm and is perfect for brain breaks, circle time, group activities or those bad weather days when children can't go outside to play.

Sidney the Snake  is also easy and fun to play or pretend to play when you need a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance, move, and even laugh, they can then return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. More and more schools are realising the significant values of breaks like this in the classroom.

"Like" us on Facebook and participate in our weekly live streams, perfect for mat times or in session music education!

These top 10 #1 Best Kids Songs for Children by The Learning Station include a collection of children’s favorite and popular kids songs featuring: “If You’re Wearing Colors”, “A-Root-Chy-Cha”, “7 Days of the Week”, “Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes”, “Tony Chestnut”, “Fill Your Bucket”, “Herman the Worm” and more favorites and best kids songs!

“Get Funky & Musical Fun” Physical CD that ships by The Learning Station: https://store.learningstationmusic.com/getfunkycd.aspx
 “If You’re Wearing Colors” by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station)
℗©Monopoli/ The Learning Station® (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
If You’re Wearing Colors 
Before starting the song have the children look at the color clothes they are wearing. Form a circle and start the song. Have the kids follow Don Monopoli from The Learning Station’s action movements for each color.
If you’re wearing red stand up and shake your head.
If you’re wearing green stand up and bow to the queen.
Chorus: Stand up no matter what color’s on you.
Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do.
If you’re wearing yellow stand up and shake like Jell-O.
If you’re wearing black stand up and pat your back.
Chorus
If you’re wearing blue stand up and touch your shoe.
If you’re wearing brown stand up and spin around.
Chorus
If you’re wearing gray stand up and holler hey!
If you’re wearing white stand up and turn to the right.
Chorus
If you’re wearing tan stand up and wave your hands.
If you’re wearing purple stand up and turn in a circle.
Chorus
If you’re wearing pink stand up and wink, wink, wink.
If you’re wearing peach stand up and reach, reach, reach.
Chorus

0:00 Intro
0:09 If You’re Wearing Colors
3:44 A-Root-Chy-Cha
7:28 7 Days of the Week

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC FREEBIES:
This song is a FREEBIE. You can stream it for free on YouTube, but also buy it at my website. I am already offering 60+ of my hip educational songs/videos on YouTube FOR FREE at youtube.com/harrykindergarten. Enjoy them, utilize them, and share them! I am a current full-time Kindergarten teacher so I know what it's like to be looking around for quality content in my classroom! You can ALSO purchase the raw video file and/or audio file of those 60+ songs at my website (if you need them for some reason) or at Teachers Pay Teachers. I will continue to make freebie videos (ones you can just stream on YouTube for free) periodically, so continue to check back to see if I've posted any. 

*Please DO NOT rip any of my videos off of YouTube and upload them to your YouTube channel. I want the Harry Kindergarten Music channel to be the hotspot for these videos, not random teachers' channels who happened to illegally take them off of mine. If you really want to have a playlist of them, create a playlist from MY channel or purchase them on my website so you have the raw files. THANKS FOR UNDERSTANDING!

Q: Do you speak at conferences?
A: Yes! My ability to speak at teacher conferences during the school year is "tight" because I am currently a classroom teacher and only have a set number of personal days. However, the SUMMER time is wide-open and I'd love to come to your conference and do a session/seminar! Some of the topics I've typically spoken to teachers about include music and technology in the classroom, classroom management, running a creative morning meeting, and utilizing YouTube in the early childhood classroom. Email me at pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com to make a speaking request.

Q: Can my class perform a "Harry Kindergarten song" for an audience?
A: If you desire to have your class or group of students perform one of my “Harry Kindergarten” songs for an audience, please note that there is a $6.00 PERFORMANCE FEE.

Here are some hypothetical examples of performance groups:
* Students perform a song for an audience during a graduation ceremony.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school or community talent show.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school assembly.
If you are unsure if you need to purchase a performance license or not, please inquire at: pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com. If you want more details about using a song multiple years or multiple classes, etc., e-mail me for a detailed PDF file. 

$6.00 can be sent to:

Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC

508 Stewart Street

Bellwood, PA 16617

title: Seated Movement & Mindfulness for Kids!
tags: kids yoga,yoga for kids,yoga for kid,yoga for kids- full yoga,yoga for children,yoga for children beginners,yoga music,yoga,cosmic kids yoga,kids workout,fun videos for kids,workout for kids,physical exercise for kids,children workout,movement exercise,fun workout,fun yoga,home workout for kids,workout at home
description:
Join me for a compilation of movement and mindfulness all to be done whilst sitting down! Perfect when space is limited or for kids in classrooms sitting at desks. 

Let me know how it goes for you in the comments below! Share the fun using #cosmickidsyoga!

0:00 Jaime's Brain Breaks | Sit and Stretch - A chair-based yoga and breathing sequence ending with an inspiring visualisation!

6:21 The Listening Game  | Cosmic Kids Zen Den - Let's play a game about listening! How well can you listen to the sounds of the bells? REALLY listen! If you listen really hard, it's amazing how long they go on for. If we can get our listening working well, we can experience the world so much more and enjoy ourselves even more!

12:21 The Owl and the Guard Dog | Cosmic Kids Zen Den
This is a story explaining how certain parts of our brain work - how the amygdala (our 'guard dog') can be so good at protecting us - a little TOO good - that it stops the thinking part of our brain (our 'owl' - the pre-frontal cortex) from doing its work!

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

title: 17 FUN BRAIN GAMES, TRICKS AND TRIVIA TO BLOW YOUR MIND
tags: riddles,brain teasers,riddles with answers,brain teasers with answers,test your brain,puzzles,7-Second Riddles,brain games,tricks,trivia,blow your mind,best you will always win,cool bets,math trick,tricky riddles,card trick,optical illusions,quiz,trivia question,trivia quiz
description:
Enjoy a great set of fun brain games for kids, easy tricks and cool trivia that will blow your mind into pieces:

00:14 - Bets you'll always win.
Enjoy this set of cool bets explained, so you can always win them! But let's have a bit of fun: first, you'll have time to solve these tricky bets or better say tricky riddles and then I'll show you the answer how to win the bet. I'm sure you will crack most (not all) bets on your own 😉
02:26 - Cool math trick that will guess your choice!
03:30 - Card trick for kids to blow your mind! 
04:00 - Optical illusion to shatter your mind to pieces.
05:23 - Cool optical illusion.
How many faces do you see? Where is the missing face? Cool optical illusion that will scratch your brain and crush your eyes! You won't believe what you are seeing and will pause the video to figure out what is happening in this cool riddle! Amazing tricks to learn and impress your friends around :) 
06:21 - Trivia and useful quiz.
How have I even been living without this all these years? I'm not even upset I failed almost all the questions of this quiz because now I know how it should work! A tough but undoubtedly useful quiz that will test if you use your Excel program efficiently. How many of them did you get right?
07:48 - Cool trivia question.
If you ever puzzle over how long a human can survive on different planets this amazing quiz with answers is just what you need! Take your trip around the solar system (virtually, of course!) to explore the remotest corners and impress your friends later on!
08:57 - Trivia quiz.
This unbelievable trivia quiz will puzzle your mind a lot. I bet you've never thought about these well known products in such terms! I never believed even lunar soil could be sold. What surprised you most of all in this ranking? 
12:17 - Mind blowing optical illusions.

TELL me IN THE COMMENTS which one of these brain games, easy tricks and cool trivia you liked the most and the least!

description:
Evening Yoga Set is specially prepared for you to spend fun and productive time with your family. We start off with Brain Break to lose some of the energy before bedtime. Then we move to Yoga Pose Universe! Let's practice some of the poses, so next time you're even better at them. 
Now it's time for some Zen Den - time to concentrate and look inside, talk about feelings and understand more about what's going on in our minds. 
We finish with Peace out - deep relaxation, mindfulness and the perfect story to get sleepy exactly when needed. Night night! Namaste.

description:
Arrrr! Desperate times calls for desperate measures, especially when your pirate ship gets stuck between two giant icebergs in the freezing Antarctic ocean. Such be the case for Captain Crabs Legs, a lonely pirate who must find a new pirate crew to help him break free and sail the seven seas, stealing pirate booty and lollipops every chance they get. Unfortunately for Captain Crab Legs, the only ones willing to help are friendly group of penguins who don’t know the first thing about sailing ships or stealing gold. Watch and read as this PlayKids original story takes you on the silliest swashbuckling adventure you’ve ever laid eyes on and discover how penguins make bad pirates!

On the fourth day of gym class my coach made me do four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the sixth day of gym class my coach made me do six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the seventh day of gym class my coach made me do seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the eighth day of gym class my coach made me do eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the ninth day of gym class my coach made me do nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the tenth day of gym class my coach made me do ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the eleventh day of gym class my coach made me do eleven blocks in boxing, ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

title: 1-Minute Brain Break Series: Power Breath
description:
*Adult Supervision required*

This one is good for kids and parents! Take one minute when feeling overwhelmed and let everything go with 5 power breaths!
1. Standing or sitting - breathe in and raise arms above head
2. As you breath out, forcefully bend elbows bringing hands toward chest
3. Repeat as needed!

title: Brain Café 2011 January - Neuroscience: John Stein Brain 101 Part 2
description:
Everett Dance Theatre presents The Brain Cafe 

January 27, 2011 

John Stein Brain 101 Presentation part 2

More info: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7KdBy...


In the coming year, Everett Dance Theatre will create a multimedia dance/theater production entitled Brain Storm. The piece will examine new developments in brain research, and the imminent neurological revolution. Many experts believe we are currently at a tipping point in terms of our understanding of how the brain works. Soon we will all have to grapple with the potentially positive and ill effects of this radical paradigm shift, as it begins to affect our everyday lives. Medical, technological and pharmaceutical advancements will raise a host of important ethical questions, such as their use by the military, the legal system, advertisers, etc. Researchers are rapidly amassing knowledge enabling them to map the spectrum of human emotions, beliefs, and tendencies in our neural circuitry. Neuroplasticity, the idea of transforming our own brains by how and what we think, is a widely accepted phenomenon.

The brain holds an innate interest and is a rich subject for a dance/theater piece. It is perfectly suited to the kind of in-depth, research-driven, and visually layered examination that Everett Dance Theatre is known for. The company believes it can play a synthesizing role, looking at disparate elements and finding unexpected connections. As storytellers, they can translate technical information into affecting human stories. As humanists, they can anticipate and critique the social implications of technological advancements. Everett will seamlessly blend elements of choreography, storytelling, factual information, humor, and video projection, to create a multimedia dance/theater experience that informs, entertains and provokes thought. Educational programs such as public forums and lecture demonstrations will be developed alongside the performance, and will extend the dialogue to grade schools, universities and community settings wherever the show is performed.

This project has received funding from Creative Capital's -- Multi Arts Production Fund, the New England Foundation for the Arts -- National Dance Project, the New England Foundation for the Arts -- Production Residency, and Art Ventures New Hampshire/Crotched Mountain Foundation.

Lyrics:
(Follow the directions: Stomp and clap to the beat and repeat the nursery rhymes in unison.) 

"Alright, this song is called "Stomp and Clap". And that's exactly what we're going to do.
But first we're going to try it so follow me. Here we go!"

Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, clap. stomp, clap.
Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, clap. stomp, clap.

Mary, Mary, quite contrary.  (Mary, Mary, quite contrary.)
How does your garden grow?  (How does your garden grow?)
With silver bells and cockle shells.  (With silver bells and cockle shells.)
And all pretty maids in a row. (And all pretty maids in a row.)

Chorus: 
Put your hands down by your side and rest your feet.
(Rest your feet. You know you're going to rest your feet.)
Listen careful for the slide then start the beat, (start the beat), with your feet.
Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, clap. stomp, clap.
Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, stomp, clap. Stomp, clap. stomp, clap.

Eeney, meeney, miney moe. (Eeney, meeney, miney moe.)
Catch a tiger by the toe.  (Catch a tiger by the toe.)
If he hollers let him go.  (If he hollers let him go.)
Eeney, meeney, miney moe. (Eeney, meeney, miney moe.)

Repeat chorus

Jack and Jill went up the hill.  (Jack and Jill went up the hill.)
To fetch a pale of water.  (To fetch a pale of water.)
Jack came down and broke his crown. (Jack fell down and broke his crown.)
And Jill came tumbling after.  (And Jill came tumbling after.)

Repeat chorus

Mary had a little lamb. (Mary had a little lamb.) 
It's fleece was white as snow. (It's fleece was white as snow.)
And everywhere that Mary went (And everywhere that Mary went) 
The lamb was sure to go. (The lamb was sure to go.) Repeat chorus (2x)

description:
Join Matt and the Sharks Family in this fun Action Animals song for kids! Count 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 sharks! Get ready to do all the movements from Baby shark to grandma shark. Help Matt sing louder and swim faster! This is a really fun song to sing with students in the classroom!

Teacher Tip: Use the thumbnail and teach the shark family names: baby shark, mommy shark, daddy shark, grandma shark and grandpa shark.

Song adaptation recorded by Matt. Animation by Weybec. 

Video and characters copyright Dream English Kids.

____

title: How sugar affects the brain - Nicole Avena
tags: STK Films,Chris Boyle,Nicole Avena,sugar,eating sugar,is sugar addictive,eating,food,addiction,food addiction,the brain,the human brain,the brain and sugar,TED,TED-Ed,TED Ed,TEDEducation,cerebro
description:
Check out our Patreon page: https://www.patreon.com/teded

View full lesson: http://ed.ted.com/lessons/how-sugar-affects-the-brain-nicole-avena

When you eat something loaded with sugar, your taste buds, your gut and your brain all take notice. This activation of your reward system is not unlike how bodies process addictive substances such as alcohol or nicotine -- an overload of sugar spikes dopamine levels and leaves you craving more. Nicole Avena explains why sweets and treats should be enjoyed in moderation.

Lesson by Nicole Avena, animation by STK Films.

tags: the learning station,learning station songs,learning station brain break songs,learning station,sunscreen song,summer dance for children,summer dance songs for preschoolers,kids music,kids songs,brain breaks for preschoolers,dance songs for kids,brain breaks on youtube,songs by the learning station,dance songs by the learning station,brain breaks for preschool,sunscreen song by the learning station,summer songs for kids,brain break songs,children songs
description:
Popular children’s summer dance song, “Sunscreen” with lyrics by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station) and performed by Don Monopoli, From the CD, “Seasonal Songs in Motion”  Seasonal Songs in Motion CD Download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/seasonalsongsinmotiondownload.aspx
Seasonal Songs in Motion CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/seasonalsongsinmotion.aspx

“Sunscreen” is a fun summer activity song where children sing, dance, and play along as they learn about the value of wearing sunscreen in the summer.  Music combined with movement makes learning about the season’s fun for kids.  Also, perfect for English as a second language (ESL) and English as a foreign language (EFL) children’s learning programs. 

❤ SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube channel today! NEW action, dance and learning videos for kids are uploaded weekly: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearningStation

LYRICS:
                                                                                                                                                                                       From the CD, Seasonal Songs in Motion                                                                                                                                        by The Learning Station   (Also, known as Learning Station) and performed by Don Monopoli                                                                                                                                                        
 
Rub sunscreen on your right cheek. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Now rub some on your nose and hope you don’t forget. 
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen.

Rub sunscreen on your right arm. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Now rub some on your shoulders and hope you don’t forget. 
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. DOING THE SUNSCREEN DANCE (could pop in on screen somewhere)
Doing the sunscreen.  DOING THE SUNSCREEN DANCE (these repeat throughout the whole song)

Rub sunscreen on your right side. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Rub some on your tummy and hope you don’t forget. 
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen. 

Rub sunscreen on your right leg. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Now rub some on your back and hope you don’t forget. 
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen. 

Rub sunscreen on your right knee. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Now rub some on your ankles and hope you don’t forget. 
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen. 

Rub sunscreen on your right foot. 
Now rub some on your left. 
Now rub some on your toes. You’ve covered all the rest.
Make sure you use your sunscreen when you’re out in the sun.
You can be protected and still have fun. 
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen.
Doing the sunscreen. Doing the sunscreen.

title: Trump Blows Last Chance To Address Coronavirus
tags: 201023__DR07covidAtTheDebateBP,News,Politics,breaking news,The Damage Report,TDR,John Iadarola,Brett Erlich,The Young Turks,tyt,progressive news,progressive media,progressives,trump coronavirus,trump covid-19,trump pandemic,coronavirus,covid-19,pandemic,covid,donald trump,trump,trump news,trump fails,trump biden debate,biden trump debate,trump debate,joe biden,biden,masks,social distancing,coronavirus cases,coronavirus updates,coronavirus deaths
description:
In the final presidential debate, Trump butchers his response to the ongoing pervasive coronavirus pandemic. John Iadarola and Brett Erlich break it down on The Damage Report. Follow The Damage Report on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheDamageReportTYT/ 

Help build the Home of the Progressives http://tyt.com/JOIN 

Subscribe to The Damage Report YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/thedamagereport?sub_confirmation=1 

Follow The Damage Report on Instagram: instagram.com/thedamagereport/ 

Follow The Damage Report on Twitter: https://twitter.com/TheDamageReport 

Read more here: https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/2020/10/22/21529666/debate-trump-biden-coronavirus-responsibility-fault

"President Donald Trump seemed poised to take responsibility for his failure on Covid-19 at Thursday’s presidential debate — and then he didn’t.
“I take full responsibility,” Trump said. He immediately continued: “It’s not my fault that it came here. It’s China’s fault.”
It’s a big contradiction, but it’s emblematic of Trump’s approach to the coronavirus. Time and time again, Trump has tried to downplay the coronavirus and dodge responsibility, all while failing to embrace the kind of messaging and policy approach that experts recommend.
Asked about failures on testing early on, Trump said in March, “I don’t take responsibility at all.” Asked about the 1,000 Covid-19 deaths a day in the US at the time, Trump said in July, “It is what it is.”"

#TheDamageReport #JohnIadarola #TheYoungTurks

title: Calming Music For Children In The Classroom █ Relaxing Classroom Music For Kids Writing Quiet Time
tags: classroom,music,quiet,Calming,Relaxing,kids,clean,instrumental,kindergarten,school,class,Quiet time,study,writing,Soothing,classroom music,music for the classroom,calming classroom music,quiet music for the classroom,calm,calming music for children,quiet time music,naptime,students,gentle,relaxing music for classroom,reading,listening,writing music,studying,relaxing music for children,relaxing music for kids,writing music for kids,quiet classroom music for children
description:
Quiet relaxing music for the classroom for kids & children. Perfect for listening to at school or to create a positive learning environment at home for writing, studying, reading or doing homework. Also perfect for calming down kids during quiet time.

Calming music for kids in the classroom created by Blanket Barricade. For a 6 hour version of this video click here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xe_J-e3n1xo

▶Subscribe for more soothing classroom music & quiet writing music for kids: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=blanketbarricade

▶This calm music can be used on YouTube for non-commercial purposes as long as you're not making any money from them or associated with a company/business. If you would like to use this calming music for children for commercial purposes contact us at blanketbarricade@gmail.com

Our slow relaxing videos are especially created to relax and calm down kids and children who are in the classroom trying to learn and study. Teachers can put on this music after giving instructions while the students and are doing their work or reading. The music will focus childen and dissuade them from talking to each other while working. It can also be played for younger children during naptime and quiet reading & writing time. The music can also be used while students are listening to the teacher but just be sure to turn volume down even more during this time. The music can be used for any age including for preschoolers, elementary students, middle schoolers and children in kindergarten classrooms.

This relaxing kids music is intended to inspire kids to learn efficiently as they will be focused solely on working on their homework.  The music is also created with positivity in mind and keeps a perfect balance between being too relaxed and too awake. The music is composed at a slow relaxing tempo and is mixed at a low volume.  

To get the full impact of this quiet relaxation music put the music on at a relatively low volume. Be sure to place your stereo system in a way so that the music frequencies don't make any rattling sounds. Played to a young audience of inquiring minds this chill music will be the perfect learning aid for a tranquil and quiet classroom.  This music is fully instrumental and is 100% safe and clean for the school.

This calm music for kids is composed using the latest music creation technology. Soft tones and ambient sounds are melded together with beautiful piano, soft chilled out hand percussion sounds and high fidelity sampled synthesizers. This quiet time music for the classroom has also been tested in a French immersion classroom in Canada where a group of 25 grade two's listened to the music for every day for a week. In addition to the teacher reporting lower stress for herself she said that the students were better behaved, more positive in their interactions and generally more focused on learning while the music was playing. A number of students around the world have also tested the music at home as study music and have generally found it useful for them in making their study and homework time more enjoyable.

If this relaxing music for kids helps your class or child to learn better or to relax please leave a comment below letting us know. Any suggestions for feature additions to our calming music for children in the classroom line of music is welcome!

SONGS:
1. Ice Fields
2. Good Soldiers 
3. Sleepyhead

CREDITS:
All music composed by Wes K.

Quiet classroom music for children Copyrighted 2016 / 2017.

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC FREEBIES:
This song is a FREEBIE.  You can stream it for free on YouTube, but also buy it at my website.  I am already offering 50+ of my hip educational songs/videos on YouTube FOR FREE at youtube.com/harrykindergarten.  Enjoy them, utilize them, and share them!  I am a current full-time Kindergarten teacher so I know what it's like to be looking around for quality content in my classroom!  You can ALSO purchase the raw video file and/or audio file of those 50+ songs at my website (if you need them for some reason).  I will continue to make freebie videos (ones you can just stream on YouTube for free) periodically, so continue to check back to see if I've posted any.  

*Please DO NOT rip any of my videos off of YouTube and upload them to your YouTube channel.  I want the Harry Kindergarten Music channel to be the hotspot for these videos, not random teachers' channels who happened to illegally take them off of mine.  If you really want to have a playlist of them, create a playlist from MY channel or purchase them on my website so you have the raw files.  THANKS FOR UNDERSTANDING!


FAQ's:

Q: Who is Mr. Harry?
A: I am Pete Harry.  First name Pete.  Last name Harry.  I am the founder & content creator for Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC.  Check out ALL of my links at the bottom!   I am a full-time Kindergarten teacher in Bellwood, PA and live w/ my beautiful wife, Jen and 2 young children, Justice (daughter) & Paxton (son).  To clarify, I am NOT Jack Hartmann, but I do love his stuff!  You should check out his website too- www.jackhartmann.com.  I am NOT Mark D. Pencil, but I have partnered w/ him before to make videos for his songs- check out his website too- www.markdpencil.com!

Q: When is my favorite Harry Kindergarten video coming back???????!!!!!!
A: I am slowly, but surely re-making most of my Harry Kindergarten videos.  If there was a particular video that you loved from several years ago and it's not  back up yet, be patient and it may re-appear in time!   As mentioned earlier, I am a full-time teacher, place a HIGH value on my family & values, and am extremely busy, so it might just take a little bit of time until you see your "old favorite" pop back up again.  Changing my kids' diapers and taking them to the playground comes before re-making videos, but if you are reallllllllllllly desperate, email me at pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com or inquire at my Facebook group page and make a request so I have it on my radar screen.  I am NOT remaking old Jack Hartmann videos, but Jack IS and you can find those as HE remakes them and posts them at his YouTube page: www.youtube.com/jackhartmann.  

Q: Can my class perform a "Harry Kindergarten song" for an audience?
A: If you desire to have your class or group of students perform one of my “Harry Kindergarten” songs for an audience, please note that there is a $6.00 PERFORMANCE FEE.

Here are some hypothetical examples of performance groups:
* Students perform a song for an audience during a graduation ceremony.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school or community talent show.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school assembly.
If you are unsure if you need to purchase a performance license or not, please inquire at: pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com.  If you want more details about using a song multiple years or multiple classes, etc., e-mail me for a detailed PDF file.  

$6.00 can be sent to:

Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC

508 Stewart Street

Bellwood, PA  16617

title: ★ Just Dance Kids 2 - I'm a Gummy Bear (The Gummy Bear Song) (HD) ★
tags: Just Dance Kids 2 (Video Game),Am A Gummy Bear (The Gummy Bear Song) (Musical Recording),Just Dance Kids 2015,I'm A Gummy Bear,Am A Gummy Bear,Gummy Bear,Teddy,Bears,Big,Music (TV Genre),Video Game (Industry),Just Dance (Composition),I'm A Gummy Bear (The Gummy Bear Song) (Composition),Wii Rip,Sabrina Carpenter
description:
"I'm a Gummy Bear (The Gummy Bear Song)"
The original 30 second video for Itt Van A Gumimaci, the Hungarian version of I Am A Gummy Bear, debuted on the internet in August of 2006. It quickly went viral, gaining hundreds of thousands of views as the popularity of this catchy song and funny character increased and spread by word of mouth. A 30 second English version was then created which helped to increase the clip's popularity and views rocketed up into the millions. By the summer of 2007, the final full length 2:30 version was released and it has been gaining views and viewers ever since.

* I Am A Gummy Bear (The Gummy Bear Song) has been recorded in over 25 languages and has been released in more than 40 countries world-wide.

* Every day, the online videos for The Gummy Bear Song are watched more than 1 million times.

* The middle girl dancing in blue is Sabrina Carpenter

Brain Break #3 (Beach Party), Kids Fitness Workout, Exercise, Physical Education, DPA
Get your students moving with these easy to follow exercises!!  
4 Minutes
During this video, students are expected to follow the movement instructions that are shown on the screen. Each movement activity will last for 30 seconds before changing. The music in the video will motivate and inspire your students.  
Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

Learn more about how I empower you and show you how to leverage our world-class education, strategic partnership and stock awards. 

Vernon struggled the first 20 years of his life trying to make sense of where he belonged and what he was going to do. Coming from an abusive and drug ridden household, Vernon was profoundly depressed, overweight with little self worth. He knew he wanted more, so he created the person you see and hear talking with you today. Starting with an understanding on being human, he learned from his grandmother and applied his educational background. From there he created a customized plan for each of the hundreds of individuals that he has coached with his system for success and happiness.

tags: Halloween Dance Party,Halloween Song for kids,Halloween Songs for kids,halloween songs,halloween dance,halloween dance for kids,halloween dance songs,halloween movement songs for kids,Halloween Song,halloween party dance,kids halloween songs,halloween dance songs for kids,halloween songs for children,skeletons,witch,witches,ghost,Kristina,Kristina's World OMG
description:
🎃 HALLOWEEN DANCE PARTY 🎃 | Halloween Songs for Kids | Halloween SPOOKY Songs 👻

Halloween Dance Party by KRISTINA from KRISTINA'S WORLD OMG is a super fun, SCARY and also not – so – scary Halloween dance song for all young children and the young at heart to enjoy during this Halloween time of the year!  Kristina makes it SPOOKY and a bit CREEPY, but keeps the HALOOWEEN DANCE PARTY kid friendly where everyone, even the skeletons and witches, join in the FUN!

Halloween Dance Party is a great children’s Halloween song to celebrate the month of October and Halloween, but can also used as an October Brain Break activity anytime during the year.  The dance movements are all simple and easy to do, which really helps engage all children to participate, and keep the skeletons and witches busy too!

We made sure to make all of our characters Halloween friendly, but most importantly non-violent and not too scary for the little ones.

#halloweendancemusic #kidshalloween #kristinasworldomg

description: The high cost -- to both the environment and our health -- of bottled water is the subject of this documentary that enlists activists, environmentalists, community leaders and others to expose the dark side of the bottled water industry. Americans may rethink their obsession with bottled H20 when they learn of the unregulated industry's willingness to ignore environmental and health concerns, and the problems that arise as a result.

Now, remember if I call out a color that you are wearing, you freeze.
And, when I say dance, you dance.

Dancing dancing all around
Dancing dancing all around
Dancing dancing anyway you please
But stop  if you're wearing BLUE

Everybody get ready to hop!

Hopping hopping all around

Hopping hopping anyway you please
But stop if you're wearing YELLOW


Everybody get ready to skip!

Skipping skipping all around

Skipping skipping anyway you please
But stop if you're wearing GREEN


Everybody get ready to twirl!

Twirling twirling all around
Twirling twirling all around
Twirling twirling anyway you please
But stop if you're wearing RED


Everybody get ready to shake!

Shaking shaking all around
Shaking shaking all around
Shaking shaking anyway you please
But stop if you're wearing PURPLE


Everybody get ready to dance!

Dancing dancing all around
Dancing dancing all around
Dancing dancing anyway you please
But stop when if I say FREEZE!

title: Circle Time - On the Farm Day 3 (There are many animals on a farm.)
tags: Mrs. April's Classroom,Preschool,Circle Time,monica j sutton,prek,monica sutton,kindergarten,virtual learning,homeschool,learn
description:
Welcome to Circle Time in Mrs. April's Classroom. I'm so excited to be aiding in the education of our young children through virtual/online learning.

Tune in weekdays for theme related circle time videos. Each video will be separated into two parts: 
(1) Circle Time Focus Board: We will be discussing the weather, letter/sound of the week, numbers/counting, color of the week, and shape of the week.
(2) Daily Message: We will read and discuss a daily message related to the week's theme

Today's lesson will focus on the information below:
Theme: On the Farm
Letter of the Week: Ff
Number/Counting: 4 (four)
Color of the Week: review (orange)
Shape of the Week: oval
Daily Message: There are many animals on a farm.
Word: farm animals

description:
Everyone knows Incy Wincy Spider, but did you know that he had a big brother with allergies? This new version of the classic tune is featured on our Cheeky Jams Album.

A perfect way to introduce and learn about allergies and how our environment can effect our systems. Don't forget to teach the children to SNEEZE INTO THEIR ELBOW OR TISSUE... Poor Igsy! A fun rhyme is to sneeze into your knees. You should try it :)

For babies, toddlers, preschool and kindergarten kids who are learning about the seasons, spiders and allergies and developing rhythm and co-ordination skills.

title: Go Bananas | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
tags: children's songs,educational songs,kids music,kids songs,jack hartmann,Go bananas,brain breaks,healthy eating,children's fun songs,fruit songs,go bananas go go bananas song,jack hartmann brain breaks,go banana song,jack hartmann go bananas,go banana,go bananas song for kids,go go bananas,go bananas kids song,go bananas song for children,peel banana song for children,go banana song for kids,brain breaks jack hartmann,go bananas song,go bananas
description:
We put a fun new beat to this popular children's favorite, Go Bananas. Go Bananas is  a wonderful brain breaks song your children can sing and move along with in the classroom, at home or at physical education. It is such a great brain breaks song because it's fun, easy and quick to do, and engages the children with lots of movement to get all those wiggles out.

Your children will love doing Go Bananas over and over again. This brain breaks song also has a positive message in it about how important fruits are for your physical and mental well being.

Children can follow my movements and be actively involved in all the actions for each fruit. (move arms like your forming the shape of the fruit, peeling the different fruit and having simple fun with all the other movements.)

Enjoy this brain breaks song through the whole year!

LYRICS:

Go Bananas

Form, form, form the banana
Peel, peel, peel the banana
Slice, slice, slice the banana
Go, Go, Go Bananas
Form, form, form the orange
Peel, peel, peel, the orange
Slice, slice, slice the orange
Squeeze, squeeze, squeeze the orange
Form, form, form the grapes
Pick, pick, pick the grapes
Stomp, stomp, stomp the grapes
Spread, spread, spread the jelly
Eat fruits every day, they help you work and play
They’re good for your skin and bones
And help you to grow
Fruits are so cool, you’ll do better at school
Go, Go, Go bananas, go!

title: Good Morning Song | A Beautiful Day | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
tags: rise up children celebrate,jack hartmann beautiful day,jack hartmann good morning song,rise up children,good morning song,Beautiful day Jack Hartmann,a beautiful day,good morning songs for kids,good morning song jack hartmann,good morning song for kids,good morning songs,good morning song for kindergarten,beautiful day,good morning,good morning song kindergarten,it's a beautiful day,beautiful day song,morning song,good morning jack hartmann
description:
A Beautiful Day is a good morning song celebrating the start of a new day. Children sing the chorus together with me, raise their arms up, hold hands and sway with friends as they sing about so many beautiful things all around.

It's my favorite and most requested good morning song. Both children and teachers love it's uplifting spirit and rhythm. The main portion of this good morning song is a repeat after me pattern.

The entire good morning song engages children in fun movements as they sing along so it engages their body and brain.

Lyrics:
A Beautiful Day  
Chorus Rise up children, celebrate, it’s a wonderful world and a beautiful day 
Hold a hand, swing and sway, it’s a wonderful  world and beautiful day  
(children answer all parts) 
Birds are flying Squirrels are climbing 
Trees are swaying 
Children are playing
 Runners are running 
Hearts are thumping 
Dancers are hopping 
Rabbits are hopping 
  
Repeat Chorus  

Buses are driving 
Jets are flying 
Guitars are strumming 
Friends are hugging 
Tails are wagging
 Hands are clapping 
Fish – ees are swishing
 Mommies are kissing   

Repeat Chorus

title: Family & Kids 'Brain Break' Home Workout | # BB4 Fit Dad TV
tags: kids workouts,family workouts,kids workout,home workouts,fun workouts,fun workouts for kids,homeschooling workout,mom workouts,dad workout,parent workouts,kids exercise,kids exercises,ab workout,home ab workout,stay healthy at home,what to do in quarantine,personal trainer,fitness channel,coach,body,abs,exercise for quarantine,fat loss,fast exercises,follow along workout,full workout for kids,fun exercises,workout for kids,no equipment workout
description:
Welcome to a NEW Family 'Brain Break' Home Workout for families, parents and kids to help you take a healthy break and exercise at home.

This is # 4 ‘On The Floor!’

Exercise is a great way to feel good and these fun quick workouts can be done by all the family together and help you feel happier, fitter, stronger and more motivated.

Remember to subscribe to my channel and please let me know how I can help you in the comments. And below is the fitness information and helpful tips for this workout video.

Let’s Do It,
Tristan ✌🏼 🤟🏼

——————————————————————————————————————————
🇬🇧Subscribe to my fitness channel here
https://bit.ly/3dvVm7Y
🔔And also turn on the bell notification so you don't miss the next ColorFit Workout.

Thanks for all your support! Remember to share, comment and click the ‘thumbs up’ too :)
——————————————————————————————————————————

⭐️WORKOUT SPECS:

Up to 1 minute prep
Each exercise 30 seconds (unless I change it :)

1 circuit for a quick 'brain break' workout
2 circuits for intermediate.
3 for a real challenging workout.
(2-3 minute rest between circuits)

Check out any of my other ColorFit Workouts if you want to try other workouts.




⭐️NOTES:  All my follow along workout videos are in 2 PARTS:

 1. Every workout video has an INTRODUCTION section first.
 2. And each ColorFit Workout begins when you see my ‘Sessions Timer Bar’ pop up above my head.

⭐️WHAT ARE COLORFIT WORKOUTS?

My ColorFit Workouts are color co-ordinated and numbered fitness routines for beginners to advanced ability levels designed to make choosing workouts simple and quick. You will get stronger, leaner and fitter, feel happier and more energized and boost your immune system naturally the more of these workouts you do. These online classes allow you to pick up some health tips, workout with me at your home or in a gym and many times the workouts are equipment free. They're all designed and recorded as real time workouts and are not 'highlights' but full length workouts to follow along with. These fast exercise programs are perfect hotel workouts and apartment friendly and some are low to no impact.

✅ INSTAGRAM: @fitdadtv
✅ FACEBOOK: facebook.com/fitdadtv/
✅ OFFICIAL WEBSITE FOR COLORFIT WORKOUTS: www.fitdadtv.com

title: Penguin Song | Penguin Dance | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
tags: gross motor activites,gross motor skills,penguin song,penguin dance,penguin dance song,penguins songs,growing pattern,growing pattern song,left and right,following directions,Jack Hartmann,the penguin dance,the penguin song,penguins attention,penguin songs,pinguin dance,have you ever seen a penguin come to tea,penguins song,penguin,penguin song dance,jack hartmann penguin dance,penguin dance jack hartmann,penguin jack hartmann
description:
The Penguin Dance is a super fun song for brain breaks. The Penguin Dance uses a growing pattern to teach left and right, following directions, listening skills and develops gross motor movement skills.  We mirror left and right sides to make it easy to follow.  

Brain research suggests that physical activity like engaging in my fun movements songs like Penguin Dance, increases a student’s ability to process and retain new material.

I think brain breaks should be fun! Parent, teachers and kids all love the Penguin Dance.

Brain Breaks including songs like the Penguin Dance help your children rejuvenate and re-focus on learning.

The Penguin Dance is on my Get on Board the Transition Train album.
https://www.jackhartmann.com/album/transition-songs-get-on-board-the-transition-train/

You can find this video on the Learning Rocks: Math Skills DVD. https://www.jackhartmann.com/dvd/educational-videos-learning-rocks-vol-1/

Penguins recorded at Tampa's Lowry Park Zoo.

Educational Song Lyrics:
Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see Chorus
Penguins attention, penguins begin

Right flipper

Brain Breaks - Action Songs for Children – Boogaloo Song - Kids Songs by The Learning Station

Here is a list of the educational action, movement, and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤ Wishy Washy Washer Woman
❤ Tony Chestnut
❤ Goldilocks and the 3 Bears
❤ Singing In the Rain with Matt from Dream English


“Wishy Washy Washer Woman”: Sing and dance as you learn the dance moves and actions to our popular silly song for kids; dance, camp, brain break and action song. #1 Best kid’s songs for preschool, kindergarten & elementary: “Wishy Washy Washer Woman” song includes lyrics and dance moves. This kids song is ideal for dance, camp and brain breaks for kids! Wishy Washy Washer Woman, is on the award-winning CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs!  ♫ “#1 Best Kid's Songs” CD and CD Download: https://www.learningstationmusic.com

From the CD "#1 Best Kid's Songs!”
